Reviews.Title: “Very mediocre”
Reviews.Author: Eldonardo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Bullfinch for two nights this past week. Found the room to be very small, bed uncomfortable, bath room layout odd, and shower control practically falling off the wall. Informed front desk of shower problem first morning after poor shower, low water presssure, and water not very hot. . Got up the second morning to find shower issue had not been addressed. Told desk again, finally fixed for morning of departure. Wouldn't bother staying there again, even though it was convenient to work situation.

Reviews.Title: “great awsome service”
Reviews.Author: Ben D
Reviews.Content: hi all i just wanted to say how nice this place is, well on young man named brett. super awsomwe guy. heres the story we lost power while on vacation, due to the back bay black out, on 3/13/12. the place we were staying lost power.thry didnt want to help us, so we called at 830am he said if anything opens i will call you, yeah right i said to myself, about an hr later brett called us back and said he had a room open, got us in the room, told us have a wonderfull day, if you need anything call. so my hat goes off to brett, thank you very much for what you did for my family, i will be stayin at the bullfinch when ever i come back to boston, thanks to brett.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel, great price in downtown Boston”
Reviews.Author: dwsnoke
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel entirely because the price was great. It was just fine. Rooms were clean and neat, and the bathroom and shower spacious. The location is just a little bit out of the center of downtown, about three blocks from a T (subway) stop. A $5 cab ride will get you almost anywhere in downtown. The drawback, or advantage, of the location, is that it is about a block from the Garden, which means on occasion it is filled with noisy hockey fans. But this only happened one day while we there there for five days. The pubs in the area are quite good, also.

Reviews.Title: “Good price!”
Reviews.Author: MisterMellow
Reviews.Content: Nice and central hotel in Boston. Small, but cozy and new rooms. Great service, friendly staff and nice big bathrooms. Avoid rooms close to the elevator, it's very noisy. Would not recommend breakfast at the restaurant, the selection is not especially good and the prices high. A good tip would be to do the 5-minute walk to Wholefoods supermarket, where you can buy cheap organic food of all kinds and sit down and eat once you have paid for it. There's even a café inside the store.

Reviews.Title: “"Wicked cool time!"”
Reviews.Author: mclent1
Reviews.Content: This is a boutique hotel that offers basic amenities but manages to feel trendy and fun on a budget. Hard to imagine a better setup if you're going to the Garden to see the Bruins and/or Celts two blocks away. Some great pubs around the corner staffed by "been there, done that" matter-of-fact waitresses who will having you feeling like a regular inside of two minutes. Also convenient for Mass General Hospital and Fanuel Hall/Quincy Market. I had a ninth floor room with a view of the city that was nothing short of spectacular at sunset. I felt like the master of the universe. Delicious home baked cookies served in the lobby with hot cocoa on certain afternoons. That said, everything about the hotel feels miniaturized, like it was hit with a half-blast from a shrink ray gun. Smallish building with a tiny lobby, tiny elevator, big beds in tiny rooms. A buddy who is a big guy was staying in another room and said he couldn't turn around without knocking something over. I'm sure he was kidding but you get the idea. Rooms don't have wireless wifi -- you have to use a cable -- not convenient if you want to answer email in bed. There's an adjacent tapas bar but I can't say much about it. We were seated on flimsy plastic chairs at tables that groaned under the weight of an elbow I guess meant to be futuristic like the Jetsons, then waited five or six minutes on our squeaky, creaky chairs for a waitress before looking at each other and going, "Let's get out of here." Place was half-busy but maybe understaffed... or maybe bad service is part of the Future World experience when we can expect robots to take over these duties. Anyway, we were soon at one of the many excellent pubs on Canal where the waitress told us they had "by far, the best burger in Boston. Boys, I'm not just sayin' it." She wasn't. It was wicked good!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Ryan V
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend. It was a great location for TD Banknorth Garden (Celtics/Bruins), Little Italy, Museum of Science, Fanuel Hall, Quincy Markey, New England Aquarium, and catching the T to elsewhere as well. The restaurant downstairs is good; some surprising choices on the menu. Big room too.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: YankeeEagle
Reviews.Content: The Bulfinch Hotel is within walking distance of the TD Garden (AKA Boston Garden) and the restaurants of the North End. Room 707 was spotless with a comfortable bed and a small bathroom. The room is probably too small for more than 1 person. The room was equipped with a blackout curtain which worked extremely well. In fact, the room was so dark that when I arrived in the evening, I fumbled around for a few minutes to find the light switch for the bedside lamp (see the attached photo). The light switch near the door only turned on the bulb near the bathroom. Soundproofing might be an issue for light sleepers. While I usually sleep like the dead, I was awakened about 3 in the morning by the guttural sounds of a drunken guest in the hallway. Wireless Internet service is only available in the small lobby. An Ethernet connection can be found at the desk in the room. If you're bringing a laptop or an iPad without 3G, you may want to pack an AirPort Express to create your own wireless network. HINTS: If you're looking for a quick and inexpensive breakfast, there is a Dunkin' Donuts around the corner from the hotel. Convenience stores are also within walking distance. Rather than paying $$ for parking, either take a taxi from the airport or the "T" to North Station.

Reviews.Title: “The Bulfinch is a big disappointment.”
Reviews.Author: Seapoint664
Reviews.Content: I wanted to stay near Mass General Hospital and was told the hotel has a shuttle to the hospital, so I booked a room. They do have a shuttle - for $10 one way. They have Internet too, but no wifi in rooms. Only in the cramped hallway and the restaurant where I was told Sorry, I'd have to leave at 5 pm because reservations were coming in. So I went back to my room with my iPad. I asked for an extra blanket for the bed and was brought a lumpy fake feather quilt that was not folded and was Still Wet from apparently being washed! The bed did not have a mattress pad. The furniture is chipped. Actually, I left and went home to Maine without spending the night. They did apologize and did not charge my credit card. The Bulfinch wants to be a boutique hotel but actually is a crash pad for 20-somethings attending Celtics games next door. Don't make the mistake I did.

Reviews.Title: “The rooms are small and not maintained.”
Reviews.Author: Yipyip111
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very small at the Bulfinch. I was most surprised when I entered the room to see how dirty the walls are and the condition of the walls. There are cracks in the drywall that run floor to ceiling. The furniture is badly damaged with large scratches and holes in it. The mattress is very uncomfortable and cheap. The sheets feel like sand paper. Overall for a boutique hotel in Boston, I am supremely unimpressed. I will not return.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to TD Garden but not great”
Reviews.Author: Steve S
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a convenient location if you are attending an event at the TD Garden. Like others have said, you can walk there in 5 minutes. There are also a few places to eat within walking distance. However, if you are going to Boston on vacation or plan to stay in town more than one night, you will be disappointed if you expect the hotel to look anything like the pictures on the website. The lobby is small and dated, as are the rooms. The TV's are not flat screens. The blanket on the bed is only slightly heavier than a sheet - no down comforters. When someone is talking in the hall, it sounds like they are in your room. There doesn't seem to be any soundproofing in the door. We were kept up until 2 am - we'd fall asleep, then another group of people would come down the hall, waking us up. This review is not meant to bash the hotel - it was inexpensive and served the purpose of giving us a place to sleep instead of driving home late after a Celtics game. However, we would not stay here again. Just wanted to give a reasonable review so that people know what to expect.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: SkiMonsterNYC
Reviews.Content: im not sure why anyone would give a bad review, this was more than fine. maybe different rooms are constructed differently? iduno, but its really annoying when you are trying to book a trip and you have these off the wall bad reviews of good places to stay. so take it from me its a good hotel. room was very nice, nicer than most places i stay, marble bathroom even. TV worked better than most hotels. We were going to TD garden so SUPER convenient, and yes there is some nightlife around this place even tho the location is awkward. only bad parts i would say is that the hallway noise can get to the room very easily so possibly loud if guests are noisey, but once ppl are in their rooms i didnt notice any noise. And also the views can be not awesome considering the wierd section of town its in but its not that big of a deal. And like i said its kind of a desolate area of town but somehow there are bars and clubs in this area if thats your thing. cabs were easy to get. If you are going to something at the TD center is hands down the best place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Seems to have potential to become a unique boutique hotel-just not there yet.”
Reviews.Author: tuckertwo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is handy if you are attending any events at the TD Garden. It is within a close (less than 5 minute walk) from the center. I stayed here recently on a visit to Boston with a friend. My room was on the 6th floor, and faced Merrimack Street/large parking garage. The pros: Handy location (three minute walk to TD Center, 5 or 10 minute walk to North Station, and North Station T stop-very easy to get to even if you take a train and walk with luggage). The staff is very friendly, and willing to help. The cons: My room was a standard king on the 6th floor, and although it was clean, it had some dated features and was small (think a bit larger than a standard hotel room in London). The walls are quite thin, as the building itself is old. The Hotel's website is a bit deceiving, and does not really show clear pictures of its amenities. I did not use any of the amenities, nor did I visit its lounge/restaurant, so I cannot comment on those. Overall, I my general feeling is that this is a good choice if you are venturing into Boston for an event at TD Garden, and are just looking for a place that is not over the top. It seems to have the potential to be a really great hotel, in a unique and historic building-it just needs some time and fine tuning!

Reviews.Title: “Quality varies by room. Great management!”
Reviews.Author: McSackle
Reviews.Content: Some rooms are tiny, some are average size. My room was on the second floor over the bar/restaurant. The floor was shaking from dance party music in the bar when we got in at midnight on Saturday night. It was unacceptable for a hotel room rental, and management moved us right away.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the Gardens!”
Reviews.Author: Linda M
Reviews.Content: The hotel was once a police station, and it could use some touching up, but the location is great if your business is in the West End. The round-the-city tour bus leaves from the Gardens, and the walk to the Navy Ship Yard is just across the bridge, if you start in the right direction. Some of the staff was outstanding; some of the staff seemed bored with their jobs. Dinner at their new tapas restaurant was good with excellent service by staff. The wine was quite good, but I hate that the serving size seems to be getting smaller and smaller - or is the glass getting larger and larger? Good value for the money, but the closest Boston Globe was about a block away, and the nearest Start\buck's was a few blocks away on Cambridge Ave. God choice of nearvy eats due to the location near the Gardens.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay!”
Reviews.Author: Sweeti4027
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after a concert and it is a prime location to events at the td garden. The hotel is clean and the service was excellent. One minor problem was our AC didn't seem to work. Other than that the hotel is clean and a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and Fantastic service !”
Reviews.Author: josh I
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Bulfinch Hotel over the weekend and had an excellent time. Out of the 4-5 hotels I've stayed at over the years (in Boston) I rank the Bulfinch Hotel the highest ! The service was exceptional, the conditions immaculate, and the overall atmosphere was quite welcoming. On several occasions the staff brought extra toiletries, towels, etc to the room (with a smile every time) and the staff out front requested some of the best restaurants in the area- If you had questions or requests things were taken care of immediately ! I would strongly recommend the Bulfinch Hotel to anyone interested in visiting Boston ! A+

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable price - but don't expect too much”
Reviews.Author: Harry A
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located for the Italian restaurants of North End and exploring lovely Beacon Hill. The hotel is situated in a fully restored 19th century flatiron building, just several minutes walk off the Freedom Trail and we found the price competitive for the area. We received a friendly welcome and found the staff helpful throughout our stay. Our room on the fifth floor was a reasonable size and adequately equipped including a coffee maker, although the television was old. Decoration was in soft cream and brown hues and the room was clean, although the bathroom showed some signs that cleaning had been rather cursory in some of the corners. A highlight of this hotel for us was the Flat Iron bar and tapas restaurant where the food was excellent and the dÃ©cor themed on contemporary reds and black surroundings were sophisticated and relaxing. We ate here twice and enjoyed both meals. Unfortunately the hotel does not have a car park, but offers a valet parking service, but at $44.00 per night this is a bit pricey. There are cheaper multi-storey car parks near by. On our first morning here we found the hotel had committed the cardinal sin of having no hot water; apparently the boiler had broken down during the night. We did receive an apology and a complimentary continental breakfast, but only when we complained at reception, still recovering from a cold shower.

Reviews.Title: “Good for Business”
Reviews.Author: CannT
Reviews.Content: Checked in late, left early but staff was helpful in short time I was there with arranging a car. The room was clean and modern. The bathroom could have used a little more attention. I always wonder why more attention is not paid to updating tile/grout when hotels upgrade/update. But all in all, would stay at the Bullfinch again.

Reviews.Title: “Pick Another One!”
Reviews.Author: Buttafly92
Reviews.Content: My stay at this hotel was the worst! They placed me in a room right outside the elevator so all day/nite you could hear all noises! The bed was so uncomfortable it felt like i was on an elevation table. Every direction i moved i felt like the bed was going to collapse! The furniture and TV were completely outdated. The TV stoped working in the morning all we had was a frozen picture, couldnt even reset the TV! The only positive features was the large bathroom that was actually clean & the location of the hotel. For the money spent I would not stay again!

Reviews.Title: “It's a bed.”
Reviews.Author: cinvil
Reviews.Content: Rooms not certain, location not great, staff a little righteous, I wouldn't do it. For a few dollars more you can have a much nicer time somewhere else. As you can see from my other reviews, I usually come on here to tell about GOOD experiences, so I'll caveat the below that I'm not that person coming here to bash. But, in this case must let you know what you are in for: Made reservations several months ahead, planning a nice get away for my husband and I. We called several weeks ahead to let Bullfinch know we would be arriving late, to ensure our room and check in would be open. They said no problem. Upon check-in, person behind the counter literally said "phew, we have a room left". I responded with "was that a concern?". He says "yes, sometimes we run out". So -- if you want to be SURE you have a room, this isn't the place for you. There is no priority on what room you are given based on reservation.. whoever shows up first gets the nicest room. Come on a later flight, you might be hosed. After a little lecture about occupy wall street and how nice the registrant thought it would be to be part of "the 1%", we were given the room keys. We were given the room right by the elevator. The view was better with the curtains closed. Loud NOISE from the elevator humming up and down, and a few noisy hotel guests all through the night. Boton is chilly in the winter. The bed has literally a sheet and a airplane quality blanket. I called down for a comforter and was brought a white good down, no cover. But made the best of it and wrapped it in the blanket, called it a night. If you stay here over the weekend, this is a commercial area and nothing is really open. The area is a little dark and scarey with lots of alleys and back corners. Nothing open in the area for breakfast weekends. Monday morning it was a happy place to be.. Again, upon checkout, told the staff about the noisy room, and the items mentioned above. The answer was "oh". We asked again about our early registration, how we ended up with the noisy elevator room, and were promptly shuffled on out the door. "Byeee!" On a positive note, check out the new balance bike service all over town, rent the bikes and ride around the Charles River, it was the highlight of our trip! This has nothing to do with Bullfinch but it was a must do for Boston..

Reviews.Title: “Nice but needs updating”
Reviews.Author: mustangstark
Reviews.Content: This is the third time I've stayed here... The rooms are clean but this hotel does need an updating. The walls have a lot of "nicks" in them and so does the furniture. Walls could use a good paint job. TVs are old but at least a decent cable (tho' missing some of my favorite channels.) The restaurant is small and one person takes care of everything (she had to excuse herself from the restaurant to run room service to a room... ) but prices aren't bad for Boston. However, this is a great location (few blocks from the T) and for mid-$100s, not a bad value.

Reviews.Title: “Did the job but no more than that”
Reviews.Author: r_ontheroad
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights on the 6th floor facing Merrimac St with a view of an astonishingly ugly concrete building which as it happens is the Mass. Department of Mental Health. Our room was compact but OK for two people and two large suitcases. It was a bit dark though (the sixth floor has smaller windows that the rest of the building) and had really terrible lighting which made reading difficult at night. The furniture is pretty dated, the TV was a CRT model but was large and worked well enough. One problem for us was the really small size of the ice bucket - too small to even fit a small bottle of milk. We asked for a bigger one but thatâ€™s all they have. They do offer to keep things in the fridge in reception for you. The location works as a base for exploring but is certainly the least attractive area of Boston Iâ€™ve ever stayed in. The Haymarket T is nearby but is one stop further along from the very frequent trains that come and go from government centre, so involves more waiting time. On the plus side, the front desk staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre”
Reviews.Author: AlexaRE
Reviews.Content: After staying at the radisson for 3 days prior to arriving at this hotel, our expectations were quite high which may have dampened my opinions. My opinion of their recent renovations were contemporary, yet I believe they used the cheapest upgrades. Granted, it's an old building with an odd shape, but some things just didn't pass my inspection. The furniture in our room was scratched and old, but not in the antique-way. The bedspread on one bed was filthy. The painting in a corner of the room was sloppy, the other walls were streaky and just plain ole dirty. There was only one ice machine in the entire hotel, which was located on the 3rd floor; after a long day of walking the last thing I'd want to do is run down and grab some ice! Finally, there wasn't any wi-fi that I was aware of. It was quite the hotel to stay at, but overall enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “My "Sicilian" girlfriend loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mark B
Reviews.Content: We flew in from NYC to celebrate my girlfriend's birthday. I tend to select a particular hotel/B&B based upon what I intend to be doing when at that destination. For this particular weekend I knew we would be doing extensive city exploration, dining out, and very little if any hotel hanging out. So with that in mind this location was perfect. This is not your typical cookie cutter hotel with the standardized rooms but rather due to the type of building and the restoration of it, most of the rooms have little in common, based upon viewing the fire escape floorplans. Our room was on the 8th floor and had a typical hotel room layout. The bathroom was clean, room was clean, and the heating and air conditioning worked well. The hotel is about two blocks away from either the North End Statioin or Haymarket, both orange and green lines. We took the Blue line in from the airport and used the T to hit some of the outer parts of the city. The North End, Seaport, Beacon Hill, Quincy Market are all within walking distance. I was keeping this weekend celebration in line with an Italian flare as the North End is filled with many typical Italian restaurants. I choose to dine at two that are not so typical but rather very romantic and cozy. Marco on Hanover, and Carmen on North Street. Both are small, cozy, very romantic, and not main stream. I did not have the opportunity to dine at the hotel restaurant but it seemed to be a nice place. The area is filled with various sports bars as the TD center is a few blocks away. If I were to return to Boston in the future I would have no problem staying here again. I was very satisfied with the service and value provided. I have no complaints. If you like that smaller hotel feel this place is just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome service!!!”
Reviews.Author: Topher773
Reviews.Content: All of the staff was very helpful. Bret was extremely informational and helpful. Restaurant in the hotel is awesome, location was awesome! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: SweetKeats
Reviews.Content: I really loved staying at this hotel! It is within walking distance to so many great areas and the T. We were able to get to everything we wanted with incredible ease including Fenway Park, Faneuil Hall, and the Kennedy Museum. The staff was very friendly and very helpful. I didn't have any of the issues that other reviewers did like that it was too small or too noisy. My only complaint was that someone had spilled food outside my door and it was not picked up for over two days which is a little gross. Overall, I had a great experience and would love to come back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great staff make this a winning stay in Boston.”
Reviews.Author: Debrev
Reviews.Content: I wanted to write to you regarding the terrific experience I had last Sunday night, October 23, at your hotel. I have never been to the northeast before. Last Thursday, I flew into Boston, got into a leased car and drove to Vermont for a wedding. I returned to Boston Sunday night before my flight out on Monday. A friend (well, the bride actually) recommended the Bullfinch Hotel. Being my first trip, I knew nothing about where to be or where to stay so I took her advice. I simply loved this hotel! Your front desk people when I checked in were so helpful and accommodating. The room was spotless and attractive. I even had a view of a part of the Boston skyline! But, the best thing of all was how the staff and the manager on duty, Brett Asselin, made it possible for me to thoroughly enjoy my few hours in Boston. I had badly reinjured my hip from a previous accident and could hardly walk. I had a long flight back to Salt Lake later that afternoon. But I wanted to see Boston so badly, I went to the front desk and got advice on the tour and the pick-up stop right around the corner of the hotel. I knew I needed to have time to get back to my room to stretch out my hips before beginning my trip home. But that just would not have been possible without the late check-out I was given. I got to have breakfast at the Flat Iron and hop on the tour bus and go for their tour of the city, got back to my hotel, stretched out and rested for a few minutes, finished packing up and was at the front desk checking out 4 minutes before my check-out time! Thanks to your thoughtful staff, I got to make the very best of my short time in Boston. Boston is a wonderful city to which I hope to return. If I do, Iâ€™ll be making a reservation at the Bullfinch Hotel! Debbie Reverman

Reviews.Title: “Good Be Better, Easily”
Reviews.Author: CapCodBlackie
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at this hotel several times because of its proximity to Mass General Hospital, the Garden, the North End and even downtown. At first, we thought it was a find because of the price (one of the consistantly lowest in Boston, especially if you sign up to their Elite Program). More recently, we have thought the rooms are too small and crowded with missed placed, dated furniture that a small room could do without. We have found some of the rooms, particularly on the 4th floor, worn and in need of a redo. The last stay the room seemed much like a small cruise ship cabin as part of the room was angled because of building shape. The front desk personnel are usually involved with the telephone or talking to each other, except for Brett who is the best person at the desk as far as to taking care of business in a timely manner and recognizing you as a return guest. If you are in a hurry go down early to check out. The restaurant is good and with the elite membership you get a 20% discount on food. With all this said, we have reservations to go back in the near future. CapeCod Blackie

Reviews.Title: “Great experience. Very clean hotel & the staff was extremely friendly.”
Reviews.Author: Diane M
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay in the North end. The hotel is only blocks from the train station and Faneuil Hall. The room was very comfortable & clean, and the staff was super friendly. Thanks for a great weekend in Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Filthy sheets, tiny rooms, and terrible service”
Reviews.Author: AdventuresInFood
Reviews.Content: It's always a bad sign when you enter a hotel room and notice hair on the pillow that belonged to the previous guest. The stains on the sheets and floor made me thankful that I didn't have one of those UV body fluid lights, because I suspect I would have been ill if I knew how truly filthy this room was. The rooms at the Bulfinch are about the size of a walk in closet... just enough room to squeeze in a bed. The staff is totally rude and didn't want to consider moving us to another room... they actually stated that "all of the rooms are the same anyway." I feel totally awful that I was duped into paying the "discounted" rate of $170 per night for this dump over hotwire. Had I not paid for the room in advance I would have certainly left and gone to a more civilized hotel. Bottom line, do NOT consider staying here.

Reviews.Title: “don't bring a book to "motel" bulfinch”
Reviews.Author: cecesimms
Reviews.Content: When I am paying hotel rates, I do not expect a motel. It started at check-in, when I noticed the clerk's suit jacket was ripped and it was just an indicator of things to come. There were stains in the room and everything seemed shabby, like it had been around a few years. I never realized until now that I expected a hotel to have pristine linens and a room in good repair. The second major flaw of the room is that there was not enough light. While the entryway and bathroom were well-lit, in the main room the only illumination was the two fluorescent bedside sconces. While I am a fan of being eco-friendly, it was not enough light to do anything except see what channels to press on the TV remote. I ended up dragging the desk light over to the night table, but the weak candle bulbs didn't do much for the cause. If you want to be near the TD Garden and other downtown locations, and don't mind overpaying for the privilege, then this is the spot for you. All others, you may do better elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Averted a very dangerous situaiton!”
Reviews.Author: marinadelrey11
Reviews.Content: As mentioned in another review - the place is NOTHING like the pictures! Location is the only good thing. Our situation became a very dangerous one because management did nothing about it! We smelled gas on the 9th (top) floor. We reported it. They said they would look into it. Nothing happened. The next night - again we smelled it. They said there is nothing to worry about. But we WERE worried about it. We called again. Nothing. Someone had come up and sprayed the hallway to 'cover it up'. Well, you can still smell it. I opened the stairwell - it was worse in there. We called again - they said we were making a big deal. This really got us mad and my friend called the Gas Co. herself! We were ready to go to every door and warn all the guests! The Gas man came and yes, he could smell it. He went right upstairs to roof. We could hear him up there... my friend went to see what was happening and the smell up the stairs by the roof was so bad she immediately came down and said we are leaving! We knew the situation was now being taken care of by the gas man but at this point we were so frustrated with management we didn't want to stay. We were glad we did move hotels because we found out the next day that they had turned off the gas completely because in the morning there was no hot water. Management didn't say anything to anyone of course! - Don't want to even think what could have happened!!! Hindsight - we should have just called the Fire Dept. We will be writing to the City and Management of the Bulfinch. I will obviously NOT recommend this hotel to ANYONE! Any place that would endanger their guests - well...

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms and disrespectful staff”
Reviews.Author: Peter_Aarhus_Denmark
Reviews.Content: We had booked 2 deluxe rooms for two nights in October (Wednesday 12 to Friday 14) at a price around $235 each (we had found the Bulfinch on Venere.com) and had of course expected to have rooms that matched price and description. However, the rooms we were given were tiny, with about 12 inches on either side of the bed before you hit the wall/windown, which made it extremely difficult to get into and out of bed (I suffered from back pain at the time) On top of that there was an iron bar sticking out under the bed, which you invariably hit with your shin because of the crammed space. There was also insufficient space on the floor to put your suitcase (let alone 2 suitcases and our room had no rack to put cases on) When we pointed these things out at the reception and asked to be moved, we were told that all the rooms in the hotel were pretty much the same size, so it wouldn't help moving, and anyway there were no available rooms, also the hotel did not have luggage racks, so tough luck. When we persisted and asked them to re-check, the staff responded in a rude way and called us "disrespectful". So if you want an enjoyable stay in Boston, don't stay at the Bulfinch, do yourself a favour and find somewhere else! (On the second day we again asked for a luggage rack and this time the effecient receptionist (Brett?) solved that problem without delay)

Reviews.Title: “work in progress”
Reviews.Author: Jan01234
Reviews.Content: There are a lot of good things about the Bulfinch Hotel: great location, free and easy to access internet, very helpful and friendly staff, and It's Not A Chain! Overall pretty well sound-insulated for an inner-city hotel. On the other hand, there is some work to be done. My room was dimly lit, to the point that I had regretted not bringing a headlight, so I could read in bed. Green bulbs are fine, but up the wattage -- a lot! And some overhead lights -- not just the bed side-table lights There was a small closet, but no dresser -- a big no-no when traveling on business. The TV was vintage 1990 -- good picture, but huge -- took up far too much space for a small room. Time to go to flat screens. The air-con was very, very loud and the fan outlet was directed straight down on the bed, rather than towards the ceiling. Bottom line -- would I stay there again? Definite maybe

Reviews.Title: “Good central location”
Reviews.Author: Maureen P
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very handy for sightseeing and close to the North Station on the T. Room was adequate although very small and the two of us had to plan our moves in the cramped space.Very little room to store clothes and only 4 hangers in the little wardrobe. However it was clean and in good shape. Comfortable beds. Hotel staff - very helpful and happy to help. We found the restaurant staff friendly and the food was excellent. Good breakfasts and tapas in the evening were more like full size portions for UK appetites.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Angie M
Reviews.Content: I was really pleased with the value of the hotel for the location. My room was clean-small but it's downtown so that's expected-and plenty nice enough for the value. The staff is very friendly and super helpful! The location is the best part in my opinion. The hotel is just a couple blocks from two subway stations, nearly across the street from TD Garden and really close to the North End group of restaurants, Quincy Market and several bars. This is certainly not a five-star hotel but it's also not nearly the price of a snotty high-end place either. I will happily stay at the Bulfinch the next time I'm in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Aartjan
Reviews.Content: Just back from Boston for a 4 days stay. The north station is a good starting point for trips, and the hotel is just 2 blocks down both haymarket and North-station. The neighbors of the hotel are just parking lots but the hotel is fine. a helpfull desk but don't try to check in before 15:00, they will store your luggage for free and you have to return after 15:00â€¦.. The rooms are good with a nice blowing airco, a large king size bed, a nice CRT TV 4:3, and above all: free wired internet and a walk-in shower. I loved to take a shower: unfortunately there was no warm water in the Bulfinch on the last dayâ€¦.

Reviews.Title: “convenient location”
Reviews.Author: zachgam
Reviews.Content: Just back from three nights at the Bulfinch Hotel in Boston. Some thoughts : Location is just a couple of blocks from Beacon Hill, and one long block from the North End. So the hotel is very convenient for touring this great city. The hotel staff were helpful, and friendly. The room ,Deluxe King was an OK size. Enough to stow all our clothes. Room was clean, and the bed was comfy. Bath was big enough, with a good shower. After reading some negative reviews, I found the hotel to be just fine. The neighborhood, the West End, does not have any WOW sights, but it is safe .The North Station T stop was just a few blocks away , to go anywhere for two bucks.. Tip: If you are in Boston on a Friday go to Jacob Wirths for a fun sing along and good food. for a good Italian meal in the North End try Asagio on Prince St right off of Hanover

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful "Little" Spot”
Reviews.Author: Stacy M
Reviews.Content: As long as you aren't considered tall, you should be okay at Bulfinch Hotel in Boston. The hotel is in a decent location, its rooms are clean, and its staff are fantastic. It's only flaw, which wasn't a very big deal as my partner and I are both fairly short, is the bed size. Typically in a hotel, we stay in a king size bed. Although my partner thinks that bed was a double, it seemed even smaller than that prompting him to wonder out loud "I wonder how tall people sleep in beds like this".

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, and at a great location!”
Reviews.Author: origins80
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really close to the North Station and Haymarket metro stations...the main attractions of Boston are only few stops away and some are at walking distance. I just wanted to hang out and see the city and didn't wanna spend a lotta $$ so this hotel gave me exactly what I was looking for. Do not expect glamor but a nice, clean and comfortable place to stay at good price!

Reviews.Title: “Reception Staff”
Reviews.Author: Poppet81
Reviews.Content: We arrived a tad too early for check-in; the chap at reception was very accommodating and stored our luggage until check-in opened at 3pm. We checked in and made our way to the sixth floor. The room was a tad tired and dated. There was no wi-fi available in the room, to benefit from this you had to sit in reception. I approached reception to ask about a taxi to the airport. The lady suggested a minimum of $30 for a taxi. I asked if she knew of any other route or way that was cheaper. She asked me to leave it with her and she would call me in the room. Not long passed and the lady called; she could arrange a shuttle for $25 for the two of us. I am sorry that I can not remember that lady's name but I would like to say thank you for your excellent customer service. Thank you. As a one night stop over the hotel is okay, but not the same value for money as the other hotel we stayed in earlier in our trip was.

Reviews.Title: “Good central hotel”
Reviews.Author: sasha98
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel whilst in Boston and must say that the staff couldn't have been more helpful. We had a problem with our room the first night and Perpetual on the front desk immediately arranged for another room for us. Brett helped us with a bus tour booking and Lynn who served us our breakfast was extremely efficient and we were very grateful to her for her suggestions for ways in which we could get around Boston to see the sights. Her advice was invaluable. All of these people helped to make our stay there pleasant

Reviews.Title: “This is not the hotel it thinks it is”
Reviews.Author: talof2cities
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business last week, and chose the hotel because it was priced within my company's expense policy and seemed convenient for much of where I needed to go. The location is indeed convenient, being walking distance from downtown and close to lots of attractions, though the neighborhood seems a little sketchy at night. This hotel seems to be trying to style itself as a chic downtown destination for travelers of all kinds. But despite its reasonable pricing, compared to other hotels, its marketing hype does not match reality. On the good side, the service was very friendly. When I checked in, late on a Sunday night, the guy on the front desk was very helpful, and recommended some good restaurants to call for delivery that evening. But the friendly service was really the only thing that lived up to the hype. On the surface, the room I stayed in was quite nice, but looking closer I could not miss the stains on the heavy curtains and sofa, the dust clinging to the net curtains, some paint peeling in the bathroom, and the aircon/heating unit coming away from the wall. Don't get me wrong, this is not a dump by any means, and the room overall was clean (though it is crying out for a proper deep clean, in my view). But it is not at the standard the hotel seems to want to hit. The biggest surprise for me in relation to the room was the heavy spotting of mold across the bottom of the shower curtain, extending all the way across and almost a foot up from the bottom edge of the fabric. When I mentioned this to reception they very promptly sent someone up to replace the curtain. This could have been a really positive experience, but the replacement turned out to have mold spots too, albeit on a much smaller scale. This kind of thing underscores the fact that this hotel struggles to meet its own marketing. All of the above, though a little irritating, were no big deal for me, since I still felt the hotel was decent value for money. However, there was one experience which colored my overall stay and means I won't be back to the Bulfinch. One weeknight in the middle of my stay there was a live band playing downstairs in the restaurant attached to the hotel. Being directly above the restaurant on the next floor up I could hear, and feel, the music, especially the bass and drums, and was not able to sleep. Calling down to reception I discovered the band would not finish until midnight. On a weeknight, and for a hotel that says it's suitable for business clients, I really don't understand how they think it's okay to schedule something like that as there's obviously not adequate soundproofing to avoid disturbing the guests. If they must have live bands, at least give the guests on the second floor some warning of the gig, and perhaps offer them a different room for the night.

Reviews.Title: “We will stay again at this hotel if we wisit Boston .”
Reviews.Author: slav47
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this nice hotel three nights until the 06 OCT 2011 and we liked every moment of it. The staff was very proffesional and kind and one of them Brett helped us a lot with our checck in for the flight.We had a big room at the 9th floor wich we enjoyed very much.I

Reviews.Title: “Colossal Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: PMGPhilly
Reviews.Content: Check in was at 3pm, and we showed up at 130. A nice young man said that they would have our rooms ready by 2, so we left to find some coffee and came back. The young man was gone, and a new attendant was in his place. We asked if our rooms were available, and an awful woman said curtly, "Wow, you are REALLY early. Come back at 3." She actually dismissed us from the hotel! I insisted that the young man had already confirmed our rooms would be available, so she begrudgingly checked us in, carrying a ton of attitude through the whole transaction. The best: I found out later that she was the MANAGER! On my second night, I had trouble sleeping because the noise of a neighbor's door slamming a hundred times kept interrupting my rest. I looked out my room to see the jerk and discovered: it was a maid!!! Banging and slamming the doors every three minutes from 130 to 330 in the morning. Absolutely no consideration for the sleeping guests. On check out day, we ate in the hotel "restaurant," Flatiron. There were only 7 patrons in the entire restaurant, yet it still took 90 minutes for us to be seated, served, and charged for horrendous, hockey puck eggs and the grossest coffee I've ever encountered. Staff needs a serious lesson in customer service (except for the valets with the red shirts... they were amazing guys). Aside from that, I'll echo what everyone else has said: small rooms, awful decor, used-dorm-room furniture, and the worst possible lobby layout. The location is fine, but not convenient enough to mitigate all the flaws. That room was worth about $75 a night, but I paid $200. Select ANY OTHER HOTEL if you want to enjoy Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great location at a better price than most.”
Reviews.Author: mnwyatt22
Reviews.Content: Small entrance that needs some work...however, the rooms are good, clean, and quite. Location is great for touring the city. Take urban adven Tours for great bike tours of the city...see Pell!

Reviews.Title: “Barcarol”
Reviews.Author: barcarol c
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was a disappointment. Rooms are very small and the lighting is very poor, was not impressed with restaurant. But staff was great! Hotel is close to the Boston Garden for sports events but too far from activities in Boston. Would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but very small room”
Reviews.Author: Traveler53051
Reviews.Content: I wanted a hotel in the historic part of Boston from which I could explore the sites. After considerable research, I picked the Bulfinch, knowing the rooms could be small. I had no idea, however, how small. I arived with 2 suitcases, but there was only one rack, stuck in a tiny closet. The other suitcase had to be used on the bed when in use. As to room to work or get arround, well there really was none. The staff at the hotel were nice and helped us plan how to get arround by foot. But in addition to the small size of the room, there was a buzzing noise coming from the wall, possibly the room next door, that made sleeping difficult. In my effort to diagnose the noise, I discovered there was a broken glass behind the bed on the floor. I suspect the housekeeping staff had not found this due the cramped size of the room. The staff tried to address the noise, but were unable to. They did provide a discount on our stay in apology which was appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced Hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: My_Hotel_Review
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a no-frills comfortable hotel within walking distance of Quincy Market & the North End, then the Bulfinch is the place to stay. We booked 3 rooms with 2 double beds at $200 per night; a great price for a good location in Boston. The immediate neighborhood is quiet but upcoming (only a 5-minute walk from the "T" at Haymarket). Quincy Market and the Italian North End are less than a 15 minute walk away, Beacon Hill is a 20 minute walk. For a simple yet delicious Pub dinner, the desk clerk recommended "The Harp", only 2 blocks away. Yes, the rooms are a bit small and cramped, but quite adequate; the furniture is spartan, with no drawers anywhere. Yet the bathroom was spacious. There is only 1 elevator, and there can be a bit of a wait at busy times. The staff went out of their way to be helpful, especially the devoted bellman who was always there for us. He even brought up a small refrigerator (the rooms do not have them, but the hotel has a few, provided on request if available; guests with medical needs get priority). Try not to bring a car; you do not need it in Boston, and parking is impossible! The Hotel offers valet parking at $45 per night; there is a self-park garage nearby charging $30 per night. If you need to get to the Airport or railroad station, the Hotel will call a shuttle van; it only cost us $15 (for both of us) to South Station.

Reviews.Title: “Economical Alternative, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: dexter6969
Reviews.Content: The Bullfinch was a gem we stumbled across on a business trip to Boston. It was located next door to the offices I was visiting, so other than that plus, I had not much to go on. I have stayed in other Boston hotels, but decided that proximity was important. Location was the initial draw and location, as it turns out, is one of its best qualities. It lies in the north west within walking distance of The Wharf, Faneuil Hall Marketplace, and the Boston Common. Apparently, this location is just outside of the high rent district and thus allows for a more cost-effective alternative (about half) to some of the more central accommodations. The lobby and rooms are adequate even for a somewhat romantic getaway. It is an older hotel with smaller rooms. In its own way it has a charm and quaintness that balances the age. As it was, we spent little time in the room being out & about a lot. The staff was helpful, though not outstanding. We were so busy that we didn't mind the lack of a pool & spa. There is a fairly decent restaurant within the hotel. When we weren't out enjoying Boston's cuisine, we didn't mind dining here. Next time I'm in Boston, I'll check the Bullfinch first for availability.

Reviews.Title: “Bulfinch Hotel, Boston”
Reviews.Author: Bobnoxious1
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel, very central, good Irish Pub " The Harp" around the corner with nice food. Boston Tour Buses stop around the corner also. Good breakfast in the Tapas bar downstairs. Friendly staff at reception good for info on Boston and Bus Tour to take. HBO on TV in room. Across the street from the Police Headquarters in "The Departed" film!

Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: Beantownguest
Reviews.Content: I'm in Boston a lot for business. I've been staying at the Bulfinch hotel - it's a boutique hotel nestled in the government/financial district. The location is great and the hotel is a good value for the price. The restaurant is a nice change from the pubs found at most places. And the staff treat the guests like family. Rooms are not huge, but spending a lot of time in the room isn't a high priority. I like a clean, comfortable place where I can get my rest. Got it all here.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny and squeezy rooms”
Reviews.Author: zephryn
Reviews.Content: Stayed with 4 friends. It was two to a bed, and what a mighty squeeze it was! Not only that, even the walkway from one of the beds to the toilet was practically nonexistent. My friend who slept inside had to crawl over me when trying to get to the bathroom. After putting our luggage in there, there was hardly any space left to do much. Front desk was helpful enough though. There is no toilet on the first floor except a staff toilet in the basement though it was clean enough. Parking is also far away from the hotel. Hotel location is good though. I'll bear with it just for that but not if I want a pleasant time.

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: relax49649
Reviews.Content: quiet hotel in the financial district and just a block or two away from Freedom Trail. The bed was very comfortable. I did not eat in the hotel restaurant but nearby is a very cheap breakfast cafe.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Stefanreyn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bulfinch for a weekend retreat to see the Boston area. The hotel was very well situated and we managed to walk the entire time and covering most of Boston. The rooms were clean and well equipped. The service was good and we would definaintly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Very reasonable prices.”
Reviews.Author: baabee
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over a long weekend. The hotel is nice, clean, comfortable. Our room had a nice sized bathroom, and the bedding was great. Good internet connection too.. The room we were in was plenty big enough. (We had some concerns about that due to some previous reviews.. However, Looking at the hotel floor plan, there are only a couple of really small rooms - if it's a problem, you could easily ask for another room) The staff was accommodating and pleasant. The BEST thing is the location. Easy walking distance to subway stations(s) and plenty of interesting places to eat (Go to the Green Dragon Tavern ~ esp. nice during warm weather when they open the windows and you can people watch) + a Dunkin' Donuts right downstairs, lol. The Old Town Trolley goes right by the hotel and the stop for it is just across the street at the hockey stadium. We enjoyed that it included a Harbor Cruise _ as that is not something we would normally do. // p.s. If your Trolley guide is boring or just not your style, get off the trolley and wait for the next one. We had a wonderful time. It was fun to stay at a historical hotel :) Boston is a great place !

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: waters62
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a 3 day trip with some friends for a wedding. We stayed in the "Suite" Which meant we had a king bed and sleeper sofa. This room was so small! Not good for 3 people to get ready in. Actually not good for anyone to get ready in. The lighting is AWFUL. The staff was not very helpful. They knew 3 people were staying in the room. When we got there the AC was set to 50 and there were no extra towels, pillows and blankets. We went down to the front desk to tell them and then went to CVS when we came back the girl at the front desk comes up to us with an armful of blankets etc and hands it to us??? On the plus side the restaurant downstairs served great breakfast and this hotel is close to the T, and the TD center. There is also affordable parking at the gov't center which is in walking distance. Oh and their wifi was down

Reviews.Title: “Probably wouldn't select again”
Reviews.Author: MargaritaFenwayI30
Reviews.Content: I wasn't crazy about the room, or the bed- it was really small and it just seemed very dated. That being said, it is in a great location, and I found an amazing price on it for my trip, so if I needed a cheap place to stay in the north end area, I would probably consider staying again. The check-in and check-out was easy and hassle free, room service was swift, if not particularly good.

Reviews.Title: “A European-style, boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marilyn P
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Bulfinch while we were in Boston visiting colleges. It is centrally located and close to the subway. We had planned to stay two nights, but our flight was cancelled and when I called ahead to say we would be a day late they were very accommodating and didn't charge us for the first night, despite their cancellation policy. When we arrived the next morning, the valet was very helpful in showing us how to get to the subway and where we were going. We knew we'd have to share a king-sized bed, since they don't seem to have rooms with two beds, but the room itself was very comfortable and the bathroom quite large, perhaps because we got a handicapped-accessible room. The decor was very modern and the bed very comfortable. I found everyone to be helpful and had no qualms with the location, despite the fact that we were two women traveling alone. If my daughter goes to school in Boston, I look forward to staying at the Bulfinch again.

Reviews.Title: “shamefull and we wont be back”
Reviews.Author: catherine d
Reviews.Content: i can only say that we were happy we paid a "cheap deal" 178 $ / night for this so called 3 star hotel. the lobby is a corridor, the elevator hadn't been cleaned in years, the dinning/breakfast area was also dirty. the waiters didn't have a clue what they were doing, getting orders mixed up, leaving dirty tables behind. The food was awful, and hugely over priced, especially when they try and charge it twice!! i cant believe this hotel dares to charge its rooms for 559$/ night, for that price and even for 178$ i expect a very different type of service, food and level of cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Location Great- Pricey for the room & amenities”
Reviews.Author: Bigelowrock
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Boston for 1 night on business and I was looking to save a few bucks versus brand name hotles in the downtown area. The Bulfinch turned out to be centrally located in the area I needed to be near and its price was at least $50 less than other nearby hotels. The hotel was clean but the room was very small with barely any closet space - the King bed basically filled the room-the lighting was terrible and I couldn't really see well enough to read unless I went into the bathroom which was pretty decent....I believe that next time, I'll pay a liitle more and stay at Brand Name 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “European flavour, American charm”
Reviews.Author: Senge-Oz
Reviews.Content: I wanted a hotel that was centrally located and reasonably priced - this was my first trip to Boston and overall I was very satisfied. The staff were friendly and very helpful. While my room was small, it was reminiscent of hotels I frequent in Europe - comfortable and well set out. The hotel provided a parking service, which was very resaonable and helpful as the parking around the city was much more expensive. The only two minor drawbacks were the lack of a real business centre and the restaurant. I hope to return to Boston soon, and it's most likely I will stay at the Bullfinch again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Boutique Hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: luckik30
Reviews.Content: As far as boutique hotels go in a city like Boston its hard to find an affordable and chic place to stay, the Bulfinch Hotel is your solution. Situated in the North End of Boston, this gorgeous building is interesting for its architecture and decor. We stayed in a suite on the 8th floor and loved the view! Checking in we were greeted graciously by the front desk staff and immediately felt comfortable. The clean and modern decor paired with a lovely scent throughout the lobby were pleasant surprises. The bathroom is spacious and beautiful, the room is arranged so that two people can move about quite easily and comfortably. The king size bed in our room was fantastic and we slept like babies. Parking in the lot next to the hotel is a breeze so we didn't take advantage of the valet services. The lounge and restaurant looked nice but we were only in town for one night and didn't eat there. Checking out bright and early the next morning was easy and fun, one of the staff members made great small talk and even had some suggestions for our trip to Cape Cod. If you're looking for a nice place in Boston, look no further than the Bulfinch.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend to anyone”
Reviews.Author: sj57
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a bit dated and shows in small ways however more importantly the management and execution of service at this hotel is poor. One of the beds in our room had a large metal bar that jutted out from underneath the mattress which caused injuries to 3 people. When we notified the front desk they sent someone up that offered no fix and shrugged his shoulders at us. We were not offered another room and when we checked out our concerns were blatantly ignored, while expressing our concerns the attendant showed the least bit interest by responding with 'Oh' and stepping away to answer the phone without excusing herself. At minimum an apology should have been offered for the injuries incurred. It seemed simple housecleaning tasks overlooked, we had to call for someone to replace a light bulb for the main lighting in the room (the room had poor lighting all around) and we had less than one roll of toilet paper leaving us with none to use in the morning. We ate breakfast in the hotel restaurant and common duties seemed difficult to complete, our table was not set, we were served coffee with no spoon to stir with, then food with no silverware to eat with. The waitress mistakenly put a hundred dollar tip on my friend's bill and had to reverse it. The waitress also had trouble remembering who had already ordered while taking orders. All in all, this hotel had too many issues with customary practices to ever desire returning.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, a bit dated”
Reviews.Author: Garlic_Chilli
Reviews.Content: There is nothing really wrong about this hotel but the decor is s bit dated. There is a strong smell of air fresher in the corridor but I can imagine that this is use to cover up the original bad smell. Staff are nice though

Reviews.Title: “Bulfinch Never Disappoints!”
Reviews.Author: adflipp
Reviews.Content: I used to travel to Boston about a few times a year and was at many hotels through the years. None of them had the personal attention that I get at The Bulfinch Hotel. From the valet parking reps greeting you at the front (a newer feature in recent stays) to the personal attention that the front desk gives you when you request something. We have a fund raiser every December which takes our group close to The Bulfinch. They helped to give us a great rate for our out of town friends that travel in. They also offered us a gift certificate that we raffled during our event. Everyone we recommended to the Hotel loved it. The small town feel is great. The restaurant which also is a newer addition - is great! The location is great for sporting events at TD Garden and you are only a 5 minute walk from Faneuil Hall & the rest of the fun. It's a quick cab ride to and from the airport as well! I walk everywhere in Boston and I feel it's a great location but not in the crowded tourist areas.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, comfortable and warm friendly service.”
Reviews.Author: NMTravellers
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights and enjoyed every minute. New to Boston we had lots of questions and the staff were gracious, helpful and genuinely friendly. Great Location at the North end, rooms and bed were very comfortable, and breakfast was cooked to order. Close to subway, historic areas and good night-life. We highly recommend this boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but dated”
Reviews.Author: SuffolkCarol
Reviews.Content: Very small room, with no space for 2 suitcases. Room had 2 queen beds, which were very comfortable. For around Â£200 per night an expensive option, but Boston is very expensive - would suggest staying away from centre and using T to travel into town if you are looking for a better deal. Hotel within 10 minutes walk to Quincy Market, so location is good. Wi fi available in reception and restaurant, but www only via cable in room, obviously no good for iPad. Do not try restaurant for breakfast - the worst egg benedict I have ever had!

Reviews.Title: “A good experience, but it pays to speak up”
Reviews.Author: Bob/Paula
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights here. This is a comfortable, well run hotel that is 5 minutes walk from the Green Line and a little longer to Quincy Market. It does pay to be assertive. Like other reviewers, we were taken aback at first by the small room with the tiny storage space. There was literally no place to stash our clothes and suitcases (we do travel kind of heavy). However, we asked for something bigger and got a room with the same closet but a good deal more walking around room. There seems to be a code - "08" rooms (ours was 908) are bigger than the "09" room we got first. So we did have to partly live out of the suitcases, but it wasn't a big problem. The desk staff was always helpful - we asked for additional hangers at 11 pm and promptly got a bunch of them. Noise was no problem, at least on upper floors. They do have parties in the bar/restaurant, so you might want to be cautious about being over it. We had only one breakfast in the restaurant, and there are nearby cafes with better choices. Wi-fi internet did not reach the upper floors, but it worked fine with the ethernet cable provided in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Within walking distance of North End nightlife, but value for money lacking”
Reviews.Author: chalega
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a weekday night from New York for a quick trip. The area surrounding the hotel can be perplexing if you haven't been to Boston before -- we weren't sure whether it would be safe to walk around as it got darker. Our room was directly off the elevator, which isn't ideal if you're looking for a consistent night's sleep. It was smaller than average, compared to chain hotels of similar scale, and had two double beds. Decor was, overall, somewhat dark, though the bathroom was modern and updated. Something about the hotel just didn't feel right. Perhaps it was the sub-$200 price tag attached, lowered significantly by joining the hotel's email list, but not enough to make it worthy.

Reviews.Title: “Room was small”
Reviews.Author: NOLA14
Reviews.Content: However if I had wanted to go to the Celtics game, I could NOT have been in a better location. The location was great!! For everything. I would definitely stay again. Every one I talked to/interacted with at the front desk was GREAT.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced. Under-delivered.”
Reviews.Author: HeatherPA
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Boston to meet up with some old girlfriends to watch another friend run the Boston Marathon. Bulfinch Hotel was adequate for a place to lay my head and really nothing more. The service in the restaurant was abysmal - they had no napkins. Literally. None. And most of the menu? Not really available. We ran out of toilet paper and had a hard time getting any. Wake-up calls never happened (thank goodness for back-up iPhone alarm). Rooms were *super* tiny. Like barely able to walk around tiny. Overpriced at $260/night and $42/night for parking. Would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “not a good choice”
Reviews.Author: phillipgoodgolf
Reviews.Content: ok, i want to be positive so your location is good and your beds were comfortable. However, I will need to stop there becuase your service is terrible! There are times when there is nobody at the front desk and if there is someone, they dont look at you as they are too busy doing other stuff! Was recommended to this hotel by a colleague and I will not listen to him again. Called down to the desk several times with no one answering, stayed on the 7th floor and had to come down to the desk and sometimes nobody was there. A very cold lobby - not friendly at all. Our two rooms needed new furniture unless they were antiques and worth a lot of money - not, the desk gave me a splinter, the wood is in terrible shape. Not worth the money - no class and definitely need ot learn how to serve customers. There was no wifi however I learned later that it was available in the lobby only

Reviews.Title: “Go for it!”
Reviews.Author: Madison613
Reviews.Content: Reasonably priced, no frills, friendly staff who went out of their way to accommodate me, well situated location with quiet, comfortable beds. I want to return!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay away!”
Reviews.Author: mmm143
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent one night at the Bulfinch. RIght away I was annoyed because there was only one person working at the front desk and we had to wait awhile to check-in. There were no apologies for the wait and no one offered to help us with our bags. The room was very small and outdated. The toilet did not work properly. When checking out I asked for a comment card, but was told there were none. We have stayed at several hotels in Boston and this by far is the worst. There are far better options. I will never stay at the Bulfinch again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: nk81516n
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location! The staff were very helpful and the rooms were clean and comfortable. The Tapas restaurant has delicious food! The best part of the hotel is the value. They have unbeatable prices!! I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: BmxFamily
Reviews.Content: We spent one night here. We travel pretty extensively and I have to say that I have stayed at chain hotels that were more luxuries with toiletries, bedding etc. There was not one upscale aspect of this hotel. I did like the shower w/ the glass door as opposed to a tub. The room was the smallest we've ever seen, and while they can't change the layout because of the historic building, they could at least furnish it with decent furniture and maybe even a flat screen TV. We ended up having to pay an extra $35 for double beds rather than a king. We also paid $33 for the parking garage that was a few minutes walk away. No Wifi in the room, but when I went to plus in the connection for internet, the plug was broken. If I hadn't been so exhausted we would have just left at this point. The front desk staff was borderline unpleasant. Zero friendliness, and I waited almost 10 minutes to check out since they had one person working on a weekend morning (while the 2 valets stood there & complained about customers). The staff offered no suggestions about the area or offers to help, and when we asked a valet where to get breakfast we were given directions to one next to the parking garage followed with a "Get a GPS next time." Granted they were standing outside the hotel and might have assumed we weren't guests, but I would have fired him on the spot if I were management. Unbelievable!!!! The worst part was a room next to the elevator; when I next to I mean we could have reached around from the bed and pushed the buttons if our door was open. The noise of people talking was unbearable; you never know how much people talk while waiting for and exiting an elevator until you spend an entire night with them next to your bed. The least they could do is put a decent door on these rooms to help deaden the noise. On the plus side, it is literally 2 blocks from the Celtics home, and 2 blocks from a T station. We've stayed in The Onyx across the street (backside). Nicer amenities, although overprices w/ very bad food. However, I would have stayed there again if I only had these two choices. That isn't saying much. Staying at the Holiday Inn Express down the street would have been wiser.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable, and Excellent Location: Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: iamadalek
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with my stay at this hotel. The rooms were clean, the beds were comfortable, and the staff was very accommodating and attentive. The restaurant/lounge serves delicious food and provides an excellent atmosphere for the night-life. I'd definitely recommend staying here not only for the comfort of the hotel, but it's location. It's near the North End of Boston and is close to public transportation. It's a prime hotel in a prime location with a prime staff. Definitely stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Location good, room small - generally okay”
Reviews.Author: CilliA
Reviews.Content: Great flat iron building - a classic. Well located and near public transport. A quick walk to 'little Italy' where lots of food choices. Rooms tend to be on the small side so not good for a long stay as may induce 'cabin fever'. Would also suspect it could get a bit uncomfortable for two people in the smaller rooms. Rooms also a bit overheated in winter. Good Internet access in room (cable) - no cost. Limited storage space so you may trip over a bigger suitcase. Bed comfortable. Generally 'not bad' but also not as much as a 'boutique' hotel as you would expect. Worth a try and I would probably use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, super affordable boutique hotel shaped like the flatiron building”
Reviews.Author: mikethebunny
Reviews.Content: Just two blocks from the north train station this hotel was in a perfect location for getting to see the best of Boston by foot.... the restaurant was alright, but overpriced. The hotel was warm, elegant and super clean.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelmed by this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Darth_Vukster
Reviews.Content: We are not picky people and a basic hotel room, with basic features and size usually is just fine for us. We even got a discounted rate for a special event and were still disappointed. Pros: Clean Close to arena Cons: Was $10 more than rate we were supposed to get Rinky dinky room - Our so called "deluxe" double should have been called the "economy" double. It was hardly much bigger than the two beds, with one bed having no access to one side because it was against the wall. If someone sat at the "desk" at the end of the bed, there was no room for anyone to walk by, you had to climb over the bed. The room was so small that they had to put in a sliding door for the bathroom, as there wasn't enough room for a regular door. There was no dresser for your clothes at all. There was a closet type piece of furniture, but it only had 6 hangers, 3 of which were used for our jackets. No wi fi internet in the room, so if you wanted to use the internet, you had to sit at the desk and plug into it. Over half the tv stations were staticy (poor reception). No parking at the hotel. We had to park a block over and walk back to the hotel. And it was $33.00 (unless we wanted the valet parking for $42).

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it! Staff is clueless, lost our car keys too!”
Reviews.Author: MXEditor
Reviews.Content: Front desk staff never helped us, my GF is in a wheelchair, no one came out to help us when we came in. Handicapped door was broken, overpriced $42/day valet parking and then not only did it take them forever to "get the car"but then they lost our keys!!! Luckily we had a spare set or what would we have done? They never comped us for the trouble, they just mailed the keys back, thanks for that...not! The "Jr Suite" was a joke, it was so small - not even a drawer to put anything in? That's crazy. Nice big picture window in the bathroom so people could see in. Not a good design. Hated everything about it except the location. DON'T STAY HERE. For what this costs, you could stay at a number of other Back Bay Hotels....try the Lenox. It rocks.

Reviews.Title: “Unhappy with Priceline and The Bulfinch!!! Will not be using either service again!”
Reviews.Author: traveler1275
Reviews.Content: I booked a 2 double bed room for 2 nights. My sister was joining me my second night at The Bulfinch. When I checked in they said they didn't have a double room for my and would put me in a king for the night and transfer me in the morning. I said that would be great because I had a guest coming. The second day I called to check in on the double room and they said they didn't have anything available and we could check back later. They did NOT have the room I booked at any point of our stay, so we had to say in a room pretty much the size or just a king size bed! Apparently if you book through priceline your room is NOT guaranteed!!! In addition they hotel ONLY has Wi-Fi in the lobby and the restaurant and the fitness center was OUT OF ORDER?!?! The only good part of this hotel and priceline was that priceline reimbursed me for a nights stay!

Reviews.Title: “Not my preferred Boston Hotel”
Reviews.Author: saratogamike
Reviews.Content: I am given this hotel and one other to choose from when staying in Boston for work, and after staying in both, I no longer choose this one. I prefer the Onyx - similarly priced and in the same location, and it's cleaner and nicer overall. I was not a big fan of the rooms at this hotel...felt very smell and a little worn. It didn't have a proper dresser, which I guess is OK but I thought it was weird...the room has this wardrobe closet thing. The bathrooms were OK but nothing looked too new. I wasn't horrified or anything, but there are better choices in the same price range.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, tiny rooms, surprise $30/day deposit”
Reviews.Author: Ramblingwelove
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Bulfinch for a school trip travelling with a dozen teenagers. The price was great and the location was awesome. We walked everywhere. Just 2 block from the commuter rail and then 30 minutes for a side trip to Salem, Mass. With 12 teenagers and a limited budget having a nice breakfast place a block away was definitely a plus. The rooms are very tiny. Maybe a foot from the bed to the wall and the front door opens right on the second bed. I could open the door while still laying down. Was very surprised at a $30/day deposit per room when our hotel stay had been prepaid a month in advance. They said it was standard and I was never quite sure what it was for. They charged it to everyone. You can imagine though 5 rooms x 4 nights x $30/night. After complaining, the manager did agree to only charge it for one room.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, better than the big box hotels, loved the lounge!”
Reviews.Author: EntertainmentPro
Reviews.Content: Staying in the city overnight, I did not want a big hotel and traveling on my own, I don't need a giant room. For me, I like a more personalized experience. The Bulfinch Hotel was certainly comfortable, the food was great and The Flatiron, the restaurant in the hotel had a lounge-feel to it. The night I stayed over, Thursday-there was a fantastic pianist playing! The drinks were pretty good too. And the nice thing is, it was close to public transportation as well as an area called Fanueil Hall, with all kinds of shops.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay!”
Reviews.Author: KristenT27
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the negative reviews I am quite appauled! This is the 2nd time I've stayed at the Bulfinch and have ALWAYS had a wonderful stay! The entire staff is always VERY friendly and helpful, holding our luggage HOURS before check-in and suggesting restaurants and giving directions. The rooms are always immaculate, and it's been very quiet even when we ask for a room facing the street. I feel safe and comfortable staying at this hotel. The beds are so comfortable and clean I feel as if I'm at home. I dont feel nervous putting my face close to the pillows or blankets like I do at almost every hotel I stay at! The only negative this time was that our wake up call came 10 or 15 minutes late and we had planes to catch. Luckily we woke up on time by ourselves. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone and we will be returning. Great stay for the price!

Reviews.Title: “A cautionary tale of poor management”
Reviews.Author: cazile
Reviews.Content: Highlights Book at this hotel if youâ€™re okay with the idea that you might be â€œwalked intoâ€� another hotel outside of Boston when you show up. If you finagle/argue your way into getting them to fulfill your reservation, you might end up in the handicap-accessible room. The layout of the room is a little awkward. How would a wheelchair get wheeled over to the bed? All aggravation aside, the room was clean and airy. There are three large windows that are practically floor to ceiling. Although there isnâ€™t much going on in the immediate vicinity, the hotel is centrally located; an easy walk to everywhere you want to go. The Story We reserved our hotel through hotels.com. Two days before our stay (which was also the first day of our road trip!), we got an upsetting email from hotels.com. â€œGreetings from Hotels.com, We have been contacted by the The Bulfinch Hotel in regards to your reservation with them. Unfortunately the hotel is unable to accept your reservation. Due to these unforeseen circumstances, we would like to relocate you to another property. Please contact the Hotel Partner Support Department who will assist you in finding alternate accommodations.â€� What??? My husband called hotels.com. Supposedly, the hotel was overbooked. I thought that only happened with airlines. During the attempt to find another hotel, the Bullfinch popped up as an option. Interesting. So I called the hotel directly. Call #1 to the hotel - The young lady who answered the phone simply said â€œhelloâ€�. No â€œHello, this is (insert name) at the Bullfinch Hotel. How can I help you?â€� That should have been a sign. After consulting with the manager on duty, she managed to confirm that we had a reservation but asked for a phone number â€œjust in case.â€� Call #2 to the hotel - Two days later, we called from the road to see if we could get a hold of someone more experienced.
