This time, we got someone who was certainly better at handling callers. This guy confirmed that the hotel was overbooked that night but hotels.com should not have tried to rebook us. He reassured us that the Bullfinch would take care of us. We would be â€œwalked intoâ€� another hotel in the worst case. We drove through a heavy thunderstorm and arrived in Boston. I waited in the car just in case we were going to â€œwalked intoâ€� another hotel. When my husband texted me the name of the hotel we were getting shoved off to, I looked it up and it was nowhere near walking distance to Boston. Unacceptable. When I questioned the poor kid that was on duty that night, he explained that one of the managers had compiled a list of who would actually get a room. We werenâ€™t on the list. When was that list compiled? To add insult to injury, the kid tried to placate us with $10 from the petty cash drawer. That didnâ€™t even cover the room rate difference. After what I hope was a calm series of questions and name gathering, the kid told us that heâ€™d call the manager and, even though I didnâ€™t see him lift a phone or utter a word, he explained that he would be able to put us in a room (that didnâ€™t exist 5 minutes ago). I understand the pressure to get as many rooms as possible booked. But when hospitality is your industryâ€™s name, a hotel should never put itself in a position where it could renege on a reservation. I would not recommend this hotel until there are significant changes to its management.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, helpful staff, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: aqp
Reviews.Content: We usually travel on the West Coast or thru the South/Southwest, and I had forgotten how small the rooms are on the East Coast. I stayed in 3 different locations on this week-long trip, and never got a drawer in any of the rooms! I got one drawer at the Bulfinch. Rooms are ~ 220 sf, with updated trendy decor, and our bathroom was large. The room was very clean, linens and towels were nice, and a bathrobe was provided. Bed was okay - if I had to choose one improvement, I would upgrade the mattress quality. We had no problem with street (or other) noise. The hotel staff is very nice and eager to help with any questions or requests. There is a restaurant on site - we ate there for breakfast. Food was good but service was slow. Location is tricky to review. The hotel is a 10 minute/ $15 cab ride from the airport and is located between the North and Haymarket green line subway stops. In that respect, good location. But it's right across from TD Garden, and there is very little nightlife or restaurants in the area. Two blocks from the hotel there is a 7-11 that attracts a lot of homeless people. The hotel does not have a business center, nor could we find one in the immediate area. Also no fitness center or pool. Parking is $30/night. Overall I enjoyed my stay. If I was willing to pay an extra $150/night I would have chosen a different hotel location, but I thought the Bulfinch was a good value for the money, and the staff really takes care of their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Service makes it or breaks it...this definitely breaks it”
Reviews.Author: xixpeachypiexix
Reviews.Content: I had made a reservation several weeks ago for two rooms with two beds at the Bulfinch. It was my best friend's bachelorette party and I wanted everything to go perfect. Upon arriving at the hotel, we were greeted by the front desk quite poorly. No one offered to take the luggage we were carrying all over our bodies and there was no luggage cart, and it took them 20 minutes to just get us checked in. Why? I have no clue, they wouldn't explain to us why it took so long, only that "it'll be just a couple minutes." I didn't realize a couple meant twenty. After finally checking in, they gave us our room keys, two rooms right across from each other, I thought, great! So NOT great. We got to our floor and put our keys in the lock and opened up to find a tiny room with one bed inside. The second room was exactly the same! So, carrying all our luggage again, we headed back to the front desk and told them that there was a mistake on their part by giving six people only two beds to sleep in! They told us they'd look into finding us new rooms, and their excuse for our original rooms? They told us that when people book rooms they usually get two beds because they don't want to share one so they figured that's what we were doing as well. I just looked at the guy that told me this and was astonished at how stupid that excuse sounded! So I gave him a piece of my mind and told him when I made the reservation I specifically asked for two rooms with two beds because we were having a bachelorette party and expecting many people to be staying overnight at the hotel. Then another person, who I had never seen at all since arriving at the hotel came up and offered us 4 rooms with 4 king beds at no additional cost, but we told him we wanted to stay together, and he gave us the attitude as if we were stupid to not take the offer! I think the stupid part was him assuming we'd be happy after their huge screw up!! We were having a bachelorette party, therefore we wanted to stay together!! So after about an hour after arriving at the hotel, they FINALLY were able to give us our two rooms with two beds, but on completely separate floors! To top of this grand ole evening at the Bulfinch, we called down to the front desk because we wanted to order room service and their catalogue didn't have a menu on the back (even though it said it would)! We were told by the front desk that we had to go down to the restaurant to get the menu and then we could order room service. I thought the point of room service was so that you didn't have to leave your room!??? The only thing I liked about this hotel at all was the fact that the rooms were clean and very quaint. The staff was rude, unprofessional, and their customer service was beyond pathetic. I have stayed at many hotels, bed and breakfasts and boutique style hotels and had never had this type of problem EVER with staffing and customer service. My best friend, the bride to be, got yelled by the woman working at the front desk (who I'm assuming was new because she had no idea what she was doing the whole time and always had to ask for someone to step in and help), and last I checked my best friend did nothing wrong, they did! I am NEVER going to recommend this hotel to any friend unless they completely change their staff and offer me and my friends a night free at the hotel after giving us a HORRIBLE start to a night that was supposed to be amazing. Thankfully the Boston bars fixed it for us!

Reviews.Title: “Space isn't everything”
Reviews.Author: LittleGemMA
Reviews.Content: My partner, soon to be spouse, and I traveled to Boston for a weekend getaway, on a dime. We were looking to have an inexpensive but well rounded trip to the beautiful city of Boston. We came across Bulfinch Hotel in our searches and, as always, we looked at the reviews to see if it was really what we wanted. The pictures we saw were gorgeous and the reviews, for the most part, sounded like Bulfinch was just what we were looking for. We arrived at the Hotel earlier than check-in and were helped almost immediately. The rooms were nicely kept and just perfect. Now, I don;t usually write reviews, this is actually my first time, but I feel it is important to shed light on a couple negatives we read in other reviews. A lot of the reviews stated that the rooms were too small. As factual as these comments are, people have to realize that the Bulfinch was not originally designed with the intentions of it being a hotel. This is something that occurred later on. It is a historic building, with plenty of charm, and as such the architectural value and historic feel definitely compensates for the minimal space. I just wanted to make sure that no one excludes Bulfinch solely on the dimensions of the room. It is quaint and inviting, moments away from many of the amazing sites. Please give this gem a try.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Guest11711
Reviews.Content: Location is always important when traveling and this hotel was great! It was right by shops, amazing restaurants, and transportation. If you don't want to walk anywhere to eat you can also enjoy some yummy tapas in their restaurant. While the rooms are on the smaller size, the beds are extremely comfortable and it's all you need.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, not so great service”
Reviews.Author: slr61386
Reviews.Content: Although I have many great things to say about this hotel--it was in a very convenient location, between everywhere I wanted to go, the restaurant was great (although the coupon that was supposed to be "tapas for 2" was really just one free item on the menu...which absolutely did not fill 2 people), the room was cozy and comfortable, the front desk was helpful when I checked in since I had a lot of luggage with me--however, this one part ruined the whole trip. My credit card was charged extra for the parking, which I paid in cash. The hotel charged for my stay twice on my credit card and then said they did not receive payment, and they kept a $50 per night hold on my credit card until check out, which left me $150 short (stayed for 3 nights) on other activities I had planned around town. That information was not conveyed to me until I had a problem with my card. This has resulted in a lot of back and forth with the hotel, my bank, and myself. It's very frustrating that a nice trip has to be bogged down by financial matters that could have been solved if my card wasn't charged 5 times for erroneous charges that I now need to file disputes for with Visa. I would stay again, but only if I can pay in cash and keep my credit card far away from them. Make sure you have a couple hundred extra dollars because this hotel freezes money on your account until you check out.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff that were very helpful in showing us the hot spots in Boston!!”
Reviews.Author: Lalya802333
Reviews.Content: The room was very clean with a contemporary feel. The view was fret with huge windows for great natural light in the mornings. The a/c was very cold and awesome and the beds were so comfortable I didn't want to get out! The restaurant that was attached i believe called the Flat-Iron was a tapas place and the food and drinks were to die for and very reasonable prices as well.

Reviews.Title: “A bit tired”
Reviews.Author: ISA51
Reviews.Content: This hotel has great staff in the lobby - very helpful, friendly so let me say that first. The restaurant too - great service there, well priced. The rooms are the issue here - tiny room with bad storage for clothing - had a wardrobe only with no dresser - no drawers for other stuff, desk was crammed in corner and couldn't have desk chair pulled out without running into bed. Am not picky about room size as understand city hotel rooms are small but maybe if functional choices were made in how the room was set up - wouldn't have had issue. Now the bad part, the bathroom had a used body lotion in it and when I threw it out, it was put back the next day - the same one?! that's a bit unsavory to say the least. Bedding was clean but towels in the bathroom were stained and while I don't need them replaced daily, got a new towel with a new stain instead of just leaving the one I was using? which was weird and a bit creepy. If they could freshen up the rooms and get a better housekeeping staff, the hotel would shine as they have such nice folks downstairs and it's a pretty good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Decent choice in Boston”
Reviews.Author: PolarBear777
Reviews.Content: Booked through Priceline. Hotel is in an older building converted to a hotel. Good: -Location is central, close to 2 T stations -Free fast wired internet Bad: -Room sizes are small, and ours was triangular which was awkward -Lobby area is very small -Some fixtures are not that great - the washroom door would not properly close and lock - you could hear everything in the room and the shower door was squeaky -There was only one elevator, which was quite slow at times Overall, it is a good hotel but nothing special. I recommend if you need to park downtown on the weekend to not take the hotel's parking, which seemed way overpriced. Instead, park at the Government Center garage, which is only $10 on weekends if there are no events at the nearby TD Garden.

Reviews.Title: “Unattractive & Understaffed”
Reviews.Author: VoyagerTom
Reviews.Content: I had high hopes for this hotel, which purports to be an upscale boutique hotel with a hip architectural edge. I pulled up in my car (in the space marked "valet parking") and sat waiting. And waiting. When I finally went inside, I was instructed to park in a garage around the corner. OK, I suppose, but I had to trail my luggage thru the rain. Meanwhile my initial peek at the lobby belied any pretense of design prowess, so I dragged the suitcase toward the hotel with some trepidation. Once back inside, the sole desk clerk was involved for quite a while on the phone, seemingly having been instructed to put answering the phone ahead of live customers. When another agent arrived and asked if I was checking in (duh,) it took him a full 20 minutes of staring at his screen before he uttered a word, wherein he told me all the rooms were blocked for people, but after a trip into the back office he said they would unblock some. Mind you, I had a confirmed by CC reservation in my hand! 10 minutes later it was off to the room, which completed the disappointing scenario with a bed shoehorned into a tiny space. OK, so the building is a rehab, but unless there is some rule that boutique=miniscule, I don't think this works. Still and all ,it seemed at least clean, if somewhat tired and drab, much in the manner of the hallways. I had booked a special rate which included 2 free chits for tapas dishes in their Tapas restaurant (the clerk said he would "take my word" that they were supposed to be included...) However, the place was empty, and I was scared to be the first diner of the night to try it out, given the fact that every other eating establishment in the area had a 1 hour wait! Good news: it's a short walk to the North End for great Italian cooking!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel sleep ever”
Reviews.Author: JMorris711
Reviews.Content: We got a deal thru Priceline, which made it even better. Great location. Close to everything and on the T-lines. PLUS...the bed was PERFECT. And the rooms were quiet. We were very near to the elevator which made me, a seasoned hotel traveller, nervous. But...not to worry. Quiet as can be. Pet friendly. Great place. I plan to go back on my next Boston visit. AND....its almost on TOP of the TD Garden for all bball and hockey games. SCORE! Stay here. You'll be happy.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with ideal location and cheap room price”
Reviews.Author: tinaamro
Reviews.Content: The hotel is minutes away from Subway stations (North Station and Haymarket). Plenty of cafes, bars, and donut shops and convenient stores nearby. A plus point: the Boston beer works is just across the street. Boston City Hall, Government Center and Boston Harbor is just walking distance away. The restaurant in the hotel serves superb Spanish Tapas! and the breakfast is nice, no buffets, just a la carte. The standard room boosts a large, King-sized bed, with a TV that has lots of channels, a radio and a coffeemaker (with free DIY coffee). With friendly staff and excellent room service, Bulfinch hotel made my 5 days stay there memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: MRT2KB
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed one night on the 4th of July. I did request an early check-in because we were arriving by train at 10:45 a.m. and wanted a place to put our bags before heading out for the day. Because the hotel was completely sold out the night before, they could not provide early check-in. However, they offered to keep our bags safe while we went out for the day, which was fine by us. After exploring and shopping for the day, we arrived back at the hotel to check-in and was told that the TV in our room was not working and if the TV was something that we wanted to watch they would upgrade us to a King suite at no extra charge (we had booked a room with 2 double beds). TV was not that important to us, but we did want to catch up of the news, so they upgraded us to a King suite on the ninth floor. The suite was large enough for us. It also had a queen sofa sleeper that my friend said was very comfortable to sleep on. There was also a desk and chair, closet with an iron and ironing board, coffee table with a fairly large TV. The bathroom had a large stand-up tiled shower, nice sink area with bottles of shampoo, conditioner, body lotion and showel gel, hair dryer, etc. The room was adequate in size and was nice and clean. Being 90 degrees in Boston the air conditioner worked great and kept the room very cool. I had booked the room online for their summer rate special and we received 2 complimentary tapas coupons for their Flatiron restaurant. I had the tomato mozzarella & basil salad. The portion was smaller than I expected, but tasted good. My friend had their caesar salad with chicken and said it was the best she has ever had. The portion was a good size and very filling for her. We also received a basket of bread with dipping oil. The food that we had was good and we were full by the time we left. I did notice the comments regarding poor customer service and have to say that we never experienced poor service from the staff that we interacted with. They were quite friendly and very helpful. I would recommend this hotel. It is centrally located to the North Station Train, the T, TD Garden, Quincy Market, North End, Waterfront, restaurants, bars, Museum of Science, Cambridge Galleria Mall, etc. I am planning another trip to Boston soon and will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service!”
Reviews.Author: lmlmlm
Reviews.Content: Could be a great hotel but the horrible service by the front office staff ruined the entire experience. Melanie, the front office manager, could use a course in service quality and responding to consumer needs. Not recommended. The bell boy was also great at opening doors and walking you and your luggage to the cab - but not once did he offer to take the bags nor load them into the taxi (on both the arrival and departure). We also had dinner in the restaurant which is attached to the hotel and again, the absolute worst tapas we have ever had (sent back 2 and comp'ed for the other 2). Both my colleague and I were disappointed with the whole experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great service, excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: EatonsNeckDen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bulfinch last weekend. We got a good deal at Priceline for the two nights. When we arrived by car the doorman/bellhop came out to our car and asked if we were checking in for the weekend. When we told him we were, he pointed to a parking spot across the street where we could park the car from Friday evening until Monday morning for FREE!!! He even went over to the spot to "hold" it for us and make sure no one else parked there while we waited to turn the car around. It was awesome and saved us at least $60 in parking. Plus we were able to access the car easily as needed to put a jacket or package away,etc. The rooms were nice...small but fine. The bed was big and comfortable. The location was awesome...5 minutes to the Garden and North Station T stop...10 minutes to Faneuil Hall and Quicny Market...5 minutes to bars/pubs. Plus there was a large produce market 5 minutes away near the Union Oyster House which was open Friday and Saturday. Overall it was a great experience for us at the Bulfinch.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location...that pretty much covers it”
Reviews.Author: TeamTurnerToronto
Reviews.Content: In Boston to catch a Bruins game, do some shopping and sightseeing. Location was great for downtown access. Staff was hit and miss... mostly miss - generally seemed bothered to serve customers. Rooms are small - practically no floor space to walk around the small double beds. Also, no parking on site... parking from a lot across the intersection with no in-out privileges - meaning if you leave for the day, you pay twice. Also, the restaurant is tapas - not at all suitable for family. Bottom line, if you're single, with no car and going to the Gah-den, itâ€™d be fine. Otherwise, stick to the chains... there's a Marriott not far from this locale.

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: Ilovetraveling19
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Bulfinch in June for 2 nights. We had a small room, very small room, but it was incredibly clean, and cozy. The bathroom was surprising, with a standup shower that had see-through doors, and a nice sink. The bed was very comfortable, although we were on our feet all day, so by the time we went to bed it didn't matter what we slept on! The staff was very nice. Our view was of the mental hospital (that's what the cab driver said it was?) across the street, which is a large and odd-shaped building made entirely of concrete. I guess that doesn't matter much. If you turn right out of the hotel and turn right at the red light, you will find a Dunkin' Donuts--something we didn't realize was there until the last day! We didn't eat at the restaurant, but it looked really nice. It was a great place to stay, but if or when we go back to Boston, we may try another hotel, just to explore.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location!!! very clean hotel with a friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: courtneyrosen
Reviews.Content: we booked this hotel through expedia.com and got a great rate of $111 a night. the hotel is right around the corner from one of the main hubs for the T (boston subway) and is within 3 blocks of the gardens, where we took in a celtics game. we bought boston go cards online before our trip and everything we need was easy to get to from the T and alot of things were within walking distance from the hotel. the room was on the small side, but was very neat and clean. the bed was very comfortable and the sheets were soft! i didn't mind that the room was small because we spent no time in it at all! when we go back to boston will will stay at the bulfinch again.

Reviews.Title: “Cute and Cosy, with Classic Charm and Designer Edge”
Reviews.Author: moo1986
Reviews.Content: This cute little boutique hotel will leave you wanting another few nights in the comfortable linens. Located near some of Boston's best attractions including TDBank North Garden, Quincy Market as well as train stations (or "T" stations), the Bulfinch is great for a few nights when you need to wake up early and get a lot done in Boston. The rooms, although on the smaller side, are comfortable and clean. If you like a little bit of class, without the huge pricetag, the Bulfinch is the hotel for you!

Reviews.Title: “OK, not excellent”
Reviews.Author: thetraveltrioSydney
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ok, but the front desk staff could have been a bit more welcoming and helpful and the rooms are a little small. There would be better locations eg if first time to Boston I'd stay closer to Faneuil Hall if possible etc. Or even in buzzing Cambridge near Harvard! It was a few blocks to the train with bags but the ground was level if pulling bags along. I was a little uninspired. A good walk to nearest cafe for breakfast. No gym, computer for internet in lobby, tea facilities in room etc- by no means standard things but make it a better stay. The bathroom was separated by a sliding door and had no window. Maybe I had been spoilt too much by better hotels during our stay in the USA.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect small, efficient hotel room”
Reviews.Author: PattyDOrange_CA
Reviews.Content: The room, though small, was immaculate. The bathroom was large and well appointed. The location was close to all the sights and transportation. The price was ideal and the staff was helpful with directions. There is a wonderful tapas bar on the ground floor. A GREAT VALUE!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel okay, however service not so much”
Reviews.Author: AuburnAlumni
Reviews.Content: The hotel location and quality were good. However, we had two troublesome incidents occur. First of all the front desk staff never informed us to have our parking tab stamped prior to departure to receive a discount. I spoke with them several times while my husband was locating and parking the car and they never mentioned it. I spoke with the front desk worker when we were leaving and she stated she would speak with the manager about crediting our credit card and call us either way to let us know. No call back. Then that evening I realized that I forgot my Sonicare toothbrush in the bathroom (yes, I know that I should not have left it-but people do make mistakes) and called the hotel and was told to call back at 8 am. Called back the next morning and the frontdesk worker reported that he would ask house keeping and let me know. After 2 hours, I called them back and was told by the same front desk worker that "they did not find the toothbrush in the room." I asked to speak with the house keeping manager and told him exactly where I left it. He stated he would speak with that cleaner and call me back. Approximately, four hours later I called the house keeping manager back and he told me the same thing. I then asked to speak with the hotel manager and was told they would call me back the next day, which I have still not received a telephone call from the manager-a week later. THE POINT- this is not what I call good service. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: kdaniel
Reviews.Content: Positive: Great location within easy walking distance to the warf, downtown, Little Italy in the north. Negatives: The rooms were clean but suprisingly small,even after visiting Italy. The staff was friendly enough however we were unable to get an additional robe and when I inquired at the desk I was told they only supply one per room but would send one up in the morning (never arrived). The air conditioning is also noisy and the maid kept taking our coffee cups and didn't replace. I took them off the cart when available.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Clean Reasonably Priced Hotel”
Reviews.Author: trishDerwood
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on a long weekend trip to Boston. I wanted to stay near the North end of town to be close to the touristy Freedom Trail/Italian north end of the city for it's restaurants. The hotel rooms are VERY small, but when you consider it's location and fairly inexpensive price (at least compared to other hotels in the vicinity), it is a bargain. The bathroom was about average size. The hotel is about a 10 minute walk to the Quincy Market/Fanueil Hall part of the city. Our room was very clean. The young staff were very pleasant and tried to be helpful, even when they gave us erroneous information. Considering that we only paid about $240/night here (including taxes), but would have paid about $400/night at the Omni Parker House (this would have been our second choice) or about $500/night at the Marriot Wharf (this would have been our first choice), the Bullfinch Hotel was a proven bargain. The only reservation I had about the hotel is that it is located in an area that isn't bustling with outside activities at night since there is a government complex across the street that shuts down at 5pm. This makes walking the streets a little scarey.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Helpful Staff, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Crowgirl33
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for three nights, renting two rooms. Although the rooms are small, they were nicely furnished, clean, and comfortable. The staff was very helpful, they printed us maps to local museums, helped secured tickets for local basketball games, and were always there to answer any questions we had. The location was WONDERFUL, it was easy to walk to Quincy Market and the North End. There were metro stops close by to take you anywhere else you could need to go. Would definitely stay here again. The only downside is no parking, but there is a parking garage a little ways down the street that you can park at for $30-$40 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Small, but clean and comfortable rooms. Good service. $30/night parking.”
Reviews.Author: ushorr
Reviews.Content: Our room was clean, but small. Staff was very helpful. In a older building with one slowish elevator. About a 5-minute walk from the Haymarket T Station. This being downtown Boston, parking is not cheap. $30/night, and that's by a special arrangement through the hotel. No complementary breakfast, although there is a restaurant on the ground floor. For affordable breakfasts, there is a Whole Foods up Staniford and to your right.

Reviews.Title: “Small but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Georgie_and_co
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bulfinch in the humid new england summer. First point - would have been nice to have a fridge in the room for water! (ps-ice machine is on floor 3 but only found that out from another guest in passing). Rooms are quite small, but clean, bed is comfortable. Bathroom is tiny but at least fairly modern and nice products. No view from the window we had. Most of the staff were not overly friendly, but were helpful enough when we needed to access the internet. Flat Iron tapas restaurant was good the night we went - good service. Would recommend only if you got a good price - relatively we paid too much for what we got. Location is pretty good for the commons and beacon hill, but you need to get your bearings if unfamiliar with boston. There is a 'T' station nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, great location, great price!”
Reviews.Author: RJP-90
Reviews.Content: While this isn't exactly the Ritz, the price is definitely right ($120). The rooms were clean & nicely furnished, albeit a bit small (although that doesn't really matter to me as I spent very little time other than sleeping in the room). It's in a great spot, very close to the North End which has the best restaurants in the city. The staff was really friendly & helpful - they allowed us to leave our bags, even though we had checked out & let my husband's parents do the same & they hadn't even stayed there! We would have stayed another night, but they ended up booked so we moved to the Club Quarters (which was a bit nicer, but more expensive & in a less ideal location). I don't recommend their restaurant for breakfast, but the lunch/dinner menu was great. I would definitely stay here again, great location!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location for right price”
Reviews.Author: westvillagegirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideal for leisure or business. It's close to the financial district, yet also an 8-15 minute walk to Beacon Hill and Newbury Street. My friend and I found it a great launch pad for shopping in Boston, the Isabella Stuart Gardner Museum, and getting over to Cambridge. I read that the rooms were small, but I think we lucked out on one of the bigger king rooms (I live in NYC though so maybe my expectations are less). In any case, who spends a ton of time in their hotel room? And if you do, at least there is free wifi. The final important detail is that the hotel is is less than 10 minutes from Logan by taxi, so you can get in and out quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: NorCalTravellingGal
Reviews.Content: Room was small and bed took up most of the space but was comfortable with good quality linens and towels. Shower only, no tub. Very little counter space. Robes provided a nice touch and complimentary toiletries were of good quality. High ceilings and lots of light. Modern decor with energy saving HVAC and lighting. Sliding door on bathroom was difficult to operate and offered little privacy. Elevator was broken at the time of my stay. Staff was somewhat aloof and hard to find at times.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: erennie101
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Bullfinch June 09. The location is excellent, more or less right in the centre of town . The rooms are on the small side however are clean, comfortable and very well furnished. The Tapas resteraunt in the hotel is trendy, reasonably priced and the food is very good. Bar in the hotel is in the Tapas resteraunt is reasonable however closed a little early, around 10.30pm. Would reccomend this hotel to anyone

Reviews.Title: “only has a great location”
Reviews.Author: travelintheusa
Reviews.Content: this hotel does have a great location, but the room is the size of a large closet, the staff is rather rude, and I was made to feel like a second class citizen because I asked for a luggage rack and was told that those are only for guests who have booked suites. Would not recommend this hotel and definitely will never stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great value, service and location”
Reviews.Author: JulieV32
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here before and love the location near the North end. It is near the T stop. AJ at the desk is so friendly and helpful. While, the rooms are small, the beds are comfortable, the rooms are clean and quiet (room 909 this time) Got a great deal on Priceline. What more could you want? Would not hesitate to stay here again--even if they took away the free fruit and water.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, central but average”
Reviews.Author: sweetiecherry
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Expedia, for about 100 $ a night. The hotel is located about 500m away from Quincy market, but if you are a women on your own, this short lenght is quite deserted at night and you pass by both a bus and a metro station. The rooms are clean, but not very bright. The sheets smell of sanitation and the furniture is kind of old. But the bathroom is nice and modern, and they supply complimentary nice natural body products. The staff is very helpful and there is a bar at the ground floor, that apparently is very nice. I'd go for this hotel is you want to stay sort of cheap, and you don't mind about not having luxuries.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the price you pay”
Reviews.Author: jnwln
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because they had a good rate of $130 for one night incl breakfast. The hotel was adequate, very modern and bright but kinda cheaply done. The room was a little grim as the window was tiny. The breakfast was ok, not great, I would have preferred a Starbucks but it was included so we had it. All in all the experience was ok but I am glad it was only a quick one night stay. The location is good, close to Quincy Market and Little Italy, about a ten minute walk to both.

Reviews.Title: “Last Minute Deal-Gret Find!”
Reviews.Author: CanadaDeb
Reviews.Content: I decided to see a concert at TD Banknorth the week of and came across this hotel as a last minute sell off and what a great find! Nice hotel, very friendly staff and a great location. A block for TD Banknorth and a few blocks from Little Italy. Really great staff, very friendly and helpful. Really comfortable bed, too. Thanks for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “great location, price and staff”
Reviews.Author: ed4bon
Reviews.Content: Had 5 rooms for the NCAA basketball tournament and was pleasantly surprised. 5 minutes from TD Bankworth Center, subway stations, Quincy Market, start of Freedom Trail, etc. Short walk to North End and all the Great Italian restaurants. Rooms are small but very well laid out so didn't feel crowded. They were clean and the hotel is very quiet at night, both inside and outside. A very nice continental breakfast was provided each morning as well as free newspapers. The front desk staff was helpful, friendly and efficient. This will definitely be my hotel of choice for any trip back to Boston. Saved over $100/night/room compared to 90% of other downtown hotels and believe me I checked them all. New York hotels should be this good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - but don't pay full price!”
Reviews.Author: PressSecretary
Reviews.Content: Firstly the location - excellent for anything you could want to do in Boston. Stroll to everything - 2 mins to Quincy, the harbour, Hanover St and about 15 mins easy walk through town to the Common. It's also about 1 min to the T (train line) which is great if you are going to Fenway or down to the JKF Museum (which was awesome!). The room was small but very comfortable and modern. My only advice on this place is DO NOT PAY FULL PRICE. We booked through Kayak.com and got it at 50% off. There was some huffing and puffing by the check-in staff when we said we had booked a twin room (2 double beds) and they said they had us down as a single (1 queen bed). Our confirmation invoice clearly said twin but they were a bit annoyed and said booking through a "third party" did not guarantee our room...HUH?! No one books direct with the hotel anymore at full price...anyway it was well worth the 5 mins of confusion - we had a great stay! Also, don't bother with the hotel's restaurant for breakfast - go down to Quincy and get a fresh bagel and coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Stay I've Ever Experienced”
Reviews.Author: sja721
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Priceline for New Years Eve. Every other room on the floor we stayed on was booked by a loud party of college students. We were unable to sleep the entire night due to their loud screams and shouts. We complained twice to the front desk at 2:30 and 3:30am and while the hotel did ask the people to calm down, they did not enforce it by any means. The loud hotel guests went so far as to bang on our door after they figured out we were the room making complaints, and the next morning a group of young men were standing outside our door making threats before check out. I believe any quality hotel could ask rude, drunken and disorderly guest to leave, but they choose to value the loud guests over us. The worst part was because we booked through Priceline, they were unable to refund us and Priceline's answer was a $10 credit! Horrible, appaling experience.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs Up”
Reviews.Author: ftlouis
Reviews.Content: Got two rooms through Priceline for a long weekend in Boston. Read previous reviews about the loaction but that was deceiving. You're close enough to the T stops, North End and Beacon Hill. Hotel staff was great. Rooms are wedges owing to the design of the building but who stays in the room with so much to do.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but austere.”
Reviews.Author: Imholidayman
Reviews.Content: Our experience echoed that of the numerous earlier reviews although the overall impression was of clean and tidy austerity compared to other hotels elswhere in the U.S. in this price range ($287.10 + tax per night). However, convenience and comparative vfm (Boston's central hotels can be much more expensive) are pursuasive.factors. And the only adverse impression was on entering our room to be greeted by a bold $4.00 charge ticket on the "welcoming" .5L bottle of water! While the rooms have been described as small they were adequate for the two Queen beds, although the freestanding wardrobe had, of necessity, to be fairly dinky. Still, there was a large screen TV and the bathroom was a reasonable size and well appointed. Location is good. It's an easy ten minute walk to Quincy market etc. and, in the opposite direction about 15 minutes to the Science Museum and the DUCK tour (recommended!) bus terminal and a further five plus to the best Boston shopping at the Cambridge Galleria. There's the subway, a supermarket, fast food outlets, a wine/beer outlet all less then five minutes around the corner (sadly no 'fridge in the hotel room though) and pubs and restaurants a little further on in Portland and Canal Streets. We were not tempted to eat in the restaurant (!) so have no comment about it. Overall a pretty good place to stay if you are holidaying in Boston. On business and expenses you might probably head for something a bit more sumptuous.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located, a bit overpriced”
Reviews.Author: scarletletters
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on priceline for $200 a night plus tax. That was a big discount off the regular rates for October (rooms start at $339 per night.) I still think it was a little overpriced for what I got. The room was tiny. The double bed took up most of the space. There was no closet, only a small wardrobe which was barely big enough to accomodate my suitcase and my coat. The bathroom had a shower stall without a tub. The walls are thin also. My room was directly across from the ice machine room, so I could hear the freezer running and the noise from the machine every time someone went in to get ice. The size of the room wasn't that big a deal, since I was traveling alone and didn't spend much time there. I guess, for the price I paid, I expected a bit more. They do furnish toiletries, cable TV, a coffeemaker and an umbrella and bathrobe in the room. Also the staff were very friendly and helpful, providing maps, directions and help with my luggage. The hotel is conveniently located near North Station and Haymarket T stops and about four blocks from Faneil Hall and Quincy Market. Around the corner there is a Dunkin Donuts, Quizno's Au Bon Pain, Half Time Pizza and 7-11. I didn't try the hotel restaurant which is open for breakfast, lunch and dinner and has a limited room service menu. It was a pleasant stay overall and I would stay again if I could get a better deal on room rates.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, shabby rooms for the price”
Reviews.Author: MaineIzzy
Reviews.Content: Second stay @ this hotel, sorry to report it did not impress this time. Staff remains wonderful and location is ideal for Garden shows. But rooms are rather shabby and in need of attention. Started in room 704, two double beds. Carpet was dirty, no care had been taken to clean crumbs and random guest detritus. Gross. Thermostat controls where broken. Asked to move. B/c hotel was booked solid, had few options, but in an effort to escape yucky floor niblets, opted for room 501. It was a grimmer room, with same floor grossness. Seriously, bring flip-flops, people. This room, for added charm, also boasted a broken deadbolt and a thermostat wedged next to a WalMart-y armoire - the thermostat was unreachable. Froze our Madonna lovin' behinds off. I'd only stay again if the rate was too good to pass up.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, nice hotel in a central location”
Reviews.Author: loopook
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a nice hotel in the center of Boston, the Bullfinch is a great choice. The rooms are on the small side, but clean and well appointed. I found all the staff to be very helpful and welcoming. Overall, the experience was fantastic and I would definitely visit this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “It All Depends on Expectation”
Reviews.Author: world_in_my_eyes
Reviews.Content: I just returned from four nights at the Bulfinch Hotel. Having booked this hotel thru priceline, I still thought it was EXTREMELY expensive for a hotel. Boston seems to have a shortage of hotel rooms, therefore the prices seem much higher than even NYC. I bid for several days on priceline and was unable to get even a 3 star hotel for less than $175 night. At first I was told it would be a double bed room, but when we checked in, late, we had been upgraded to a king size bed (thankfully). I can't imagine paying $200 per night for one double bed!! The staff were always helpful and courteous. Although beware the 'car service' back to the airport. I asked for a taxi and the girl called a limo. I flagged down a taxi before I realized what was happening. The limo pulled up at the same time as the taxi. A taxi cost me $15 at 7am on a Monday, and the car service thru the hotel would have been $25. The front desk told me it would be cheaper for the car, when in fact it was not. I think you are better off in a taxi unless traffic is horrible. It took about 10 minutes to get to Logan from the hotel. The room was on the small side but I had no expectation that it would be large given all that I had read. I was happy enough to have the king size bed. The linens were clean and comfortable, with a lot of pillows on the bed. A decent size TV, coffee maker, and free internet access were a good perk. The towels were fluffy and soaps were above average quality. The walls had some damage, which for the price, I would expect not to see. Overall, it was very clean and comfortable and met my expectation on this front. The location is great. A very quick walk to the North End, Boston Common or Quincy Market/Fanueil Hall. Also close to Haymarket or North Station train stations. Boston is really small and easy to navigate on foot. If you are accustomed to walking, you will love Boston. The area was quiet and almost deserted at night. We only ate one breakfast at the restaurant, and it was good. Otherwise, there is a Dunkin Donuts or Au Bon Pain right around the corner. I did have some issues with noise from the hallway. We were in room 505, around the corner from the elevator. Our neighbors came home late/early and were quite noisy and woke me up. The door to the hallway seemed thin and I was able to hear conversations in the hallway very easily. Overall, the Bulfinch is a comfortable, clean hotel in a convenient location. It's even better if you get a discount.

Reviews.Title: “Unable to recommend”
Reviews.Author: ChickenandWaffles
Reviews.Content: This hotel does not belong in the top 20 hotels by any stretch, although it was clean and relatively inexpensive. The staff is pleasant but inexperienced in customer relations, the rooms are tiny disproportionate to value (price/location), and security is an issue. Key cards work intermittently, the tiny lobby desk was unoccupied on occasion. Could be a nice place if they stepped it up.

Reviews.Title: “Problems at the Bulfinch”
Reviews.Author: luckyhoo1
Reviews.Content: I hesitate to write a poor review based upon 1 bad experience. However, I believe the problem that I experienced speaks volumes about the management of the Bulfinch. I stayed there one night. My initial greeting and the appearance of my room was good. However, the problem began at approximately midnight when a hotel neighbor began knocking on a nearby hotel room door and calling for someone to let the neighbor into the room. I don't want to go into too much detail about the neighbor, but suffice it to say, the knocking and yelling created disturbing noise for a full 2 hours, until about 2am. Being a frequent traveler for business, I realize that some amount of noise from hotel neighbors comes with the territory. And, I do realize that a hotel does not have control over the problems that may occur with its guests. However, the hotel has absolute control over how they handle such a situation, and the Bulfinch fails on many levels. Problem #1: the hotel lost the master key. Problem #2: the hotel let a guest know that they lost the master key. Problem #3: the hotel allowed guests to be disturbed during prime sleeping hours for a full 2 hours (approx midnight to 2am). There is absolutely no excuse for this lack of management control. As an aside, another guest on my floor had placed a room service tray outside the door (which I noticed sometime around 9pm) and this tray still sat at the door by 8:30am the next day. By itself this might seem picky, but again, I think it is indicative of a bigger problem with management. Had management responded timely and properly to the extraordinary circumstance of one of its obviously distressed guests (my hotel neighbor), I would have been writing a very different opinion. I did wait a week to write this so I could settle down and have some perspective. Hopefully, the Bulfinch will learn from this experience and hone its management skills so as not to put any future guests through what we had to endure.

Reviews.Title: “Well designed, but lacking”
Reviews.Author: ophiodon
Reviews.Content: The Bulfinch has the typical, but well designed austerity of a lot of modern botique hotels. Pros: Service was nice and prompt. Rooms were smaller than expected, but bed was comfortable. Great location! Right in the north end. The food in the restaurant was pretty good too. Big Cons: Shower ran out of hot water! This is seriously unacceptable in a developed country. I'll tolerate it in the developing world and tropics, but not in Boston. The gym was pretty sad, and there was no way to adjust the ac, so with two people working out (only 3 would fit, by the way), it was a sauna. I still prefer the Omni when staying around Government Center.

Reviews.Title: “Good option in pricey Boston”
Reviews.Author: lakeflyer
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Bulfinch in May 2008 for four nights. I found the location of the hotel to be a bit removed from the main action of the town, but close enough to walk to Faniuel Hall and Quincy Market in about five minutes. That was actually a great thing since it seemed to be a bit quieter in the hotel, making it easier to sleep. I arrived at the hotel a bit too early for the 3:30 p.m. check-in but the hotel gladly held my bags while I searched for lunch in the area. It's only a short walk to the pubs that line the streets leading to the Boston Garden. The personnel at the hotel seemed friendly and helpful. When I returned to the hotel to check-in, the process was quick and efficient. The small lobby requires some manuevering if you have big bags. A nice touch - there's water dispensers next to the elevator, great refresh on a hot day. The rooms are small, but it is a city hotel in a really cool building. The style is a bit modern, with some retro touches. Because of the architecture of the building, my room had a funky, long hallway-shaped bathroom. The bathroom was nice, marble counters and good amenities. My bath only had a stand-up shower, which is fine for me, since I don't normally take baths in hotels. Good water pressure in the shower too! The bed was comfortable and the reading lights were adequate. The only complaints I had was there was no closet, just a wardrobe and more importantly to me, no luggage rack and that the air conditioner unit blew directly on you if you were working at the desk, which seems like I'm reaching to complain about something! I did not eat in the hotel restaurant so I can't comment on that. But I did really like this hotel. It was small enough to be friendly and it was only a long block from the Blue Line T stop (to go to and from the airport). I walked to my conference about a mile away and got to pass right by some of the historic sights in Boston. I would definitely stay in the Bulfinch again.

Reviews.Title: “nice location, small room”
Reviews.Author: icewoman21
Reviews.Content: My husband, son and I stayed at the Bulfinch for a weekend. The room was indeed quite small and ours happened to be right next to the elevator. I almost requested another room, but I thought we could survive one weekend and we did, although we heard everything. I attribute that more to oblivious people rather than a problem with the hotel itself. We truly were tripping over each other and our suitcases, but not a big deal because who wants to spend a lot of time in a hotel in Boston? Everyone we encountered from the staff was very helpful and friendly, including giving parking information, restaurant suggestions and directions. Parking was about 3 blocks away and was $25 per day with no in and out privileges. Since we had already paid for an essentially useless car rental, we walked everywhere. We did not try the restaurant, but the menu looked good. We ate at Johhnies (very close by) for dinner to watch a college baseball game. There is a Dunkin Donuts and Au Bon Pain close by for breakfast. One nice touch that nobody has mentioned is the coolers of water with lemon or lime in the lobby...wonderful after walking around Boston all day! The location is nicely located for all the typical touristy stuff....North End, Freedom Trail, Faneuil Hall, Quincy Market and the Science Museum. All in all a great hotel in a great location at a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Stained Linens!”
Reviews.Author: BK_to_MA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my mother for 3 nights. The staff was very accommodating and very friendly. I would agree with the other reviews that the rooms were on the small side, but they were very nice. The location is nice as well, it's near the TD Banknorth Garden and walking distance to MGH, Beacon Hill, and the Boston Commons (if you are up for a good walk). The only complaint I would have was that the linens were dirty... The first night we stayed in the hotel we were exhausted and hadn't noticed, but when we woke up in the morning realized there was chocolate on the sheets and pillow cases. We immediately requested the linens to be changed, and the hotel staff was very helpful in making sure that was taken care of. However, even though our sheets were replaced with clean ones, they were replaced with stained ones. While I was confident the linens were clean, having stained linens is not necessarily the most comfortable or relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect little hotel”
Reviews.Author: loopook
Reviews.Content: The Bullfinch is a perfectly located hotel, right in the middle of the city, and beautifully appointed. The staff was friendly and helpful, and the price was much more reasonable than larger, chain hotels in the area. The rooms were a little on the small side, but that seemed a small price to pay for a great hotel. It even has its own restaurant and room service.

Reviews.Title: “Bullish on the Bulfinch”
Reviews.Author: mainemojo
Reviews.Content: The Bulfinch is an affordable, enjoyable alternative to high-priced chain hotels. Room was small, but comfortable and clean, with a king bed that took most of the space. Staff was pleasant and helpful. Flat Iron restaurant serves breakfast and dinner, with a great tapas menu at night that makes dining at the hotel an attractive alternative to going out. The restaurant is named for the building's shape -- a distinctive "anvil" conveniently located within walking distance to Government Center, Quincy Market, TD Banknorth Garden, Mass General Hospital and Charles Street. Drawbacks: $25/day self-parking is off-site, no online reservations, small fitness room (1 treadmill, 1 cross-trainer, 1 bike) directions on the Web site aren't exactly right (Govt. Center is Exit 24 on I-93, not Exit 23). Overall, a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Super Place”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinWizard
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while in town for the brewers/red sox games....the hotel staff was very friendly and helpful.....the room very nice and ample space...very clean and comfortable......hotel itself is also very clean and well kept.....price was $261.00 total....location is nice...area is safe and subway stops are with a couple of blocks or so.....subway system is nice but can be a bit confusing, pay attention......takes about 20 mins. to get to fenway park using the "T" (subway), including walking time......cab takes about 10 mins. max., and is about $10..........had a great time in Boston and will definately go back....will try for the Bulfinch again....

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place, Good Price!”
Reviews.Author: mokuspokus
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 2 nights at the Bullfinch. I booked it after reading a few reviews on tripadvisor and finding that it was one of the less expensive hotels in downtown Boston. We arrived to a courteous bellman who helped us with our baggage. Then, the desk attendant told us that they didn't have the room that I had booked! I was pissed! She told us that she would have to upgrade us to a room with a King Size bed. Yeah, right... I thought. Well, as it turned out, she DID upgrade us to a very nice room, one at the apex of the triangular hotel and the room was very nice. Crisp, clean, heavy sheets, very clean bathroom, etc. One of the nicest things was some of the staff. The bellman was very friendly and helpful and got a map out and drew where we wanted to go and pointed out some other things (restaraunts,etc.) of where we might want to go. Also the bar was nice for a drink of too. A little pricey but they also had some nice appetizer-type food. Try the little "slider" (mini-burgers). They were really good! The bartender was really fun to talk with - knew a lot about the area, the local sports teams (Red Sox, Celtics, etc.) so we all had a great time. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: suzimitchell
Reviews.Content: Excellent Location, Clean, Reasonable Prices â€“ We will stay there again! Easy walk to the T, the Garden, the North End for Italian Food, the Freedom Trail, Quincy Market and Faneuil Hall.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: deltacogirl
Reviews.Content: The rooms are on the smaller side, but not bad at all. I booked through a discount site, so I got a fantastic deal, a really amazing price for Boston. The hotel was clean and updated, had a great feel to it. The staff was friendly and helpful, despite being very busy. Its about a block from the TD Banknorth Garden and the North Station, and just a couple blocks from Quincy Market. For being so close to the Garden, with the Bruins in the finals, and with a Bruins win, the hotel was surprisingly quiet. We were actually there for a Red Sox vs. Yankees game, and got back late, but its was a great stay. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: emg0922
Reviews.Content: Perfect location!! The rooms are small but very clean. The front desk staff - amazing!! They were extremely helpful and full of suggestions for restaurants. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Bulfinch - great location”
Reviews.Author: Midwesternmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bulfinch last summer based on the reviews on this site. All the reviews were accurate. The best "feature" of this hotel is its location. Everywhere we wanted to go was within walking distance. If we needed the subway - again the subway stop was very conveniently located to the hotel. The staff seemed ok and the restaurant a bit pricey. The room was average - but suited our needs. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great location nice place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: blueoasis
Reviews.Content: we stayed in boston at the Bulfinch for an overnight (actually last night). we arrived in boston via the downeaster train from dover nh at around 11am and went right to the hotel to check in. the staff was very pleasant. they allowed us to check in right away and go right up to our room. the lobby was small but nicely decorated with lemon and lime water available as well as fresh fruit and muffins. there were no surprises when we entered the room it looked like the pics and was as other posters have stated "small" but very nicely dressed. there are no luggage rack or fan in the bathroom but the room was very clean. no odors or hairs or stains anywhere. almost new looking. we dropped our overnight bag and headed out for the day to walk the freedom trail. we were greeted warmly when we returned at around 4:30 to shower and change for dinner and show. we were again acknowledged warmly when we returned at the end of our evening. the plan was to have a snack and and a night cap in the tapas bar but the north end dinner at la summa did me in. so i can not give a review but did notice that there was always a few tables with people in there. the mattress was a little on the firm side (i am a fan of the pillowtop) and there were plenty of pillows (6 in all i think) there was a down alternative comforter on the top which was so comfy!! we walked down to dunkin donuts right down the street (new englanders you know) for coffee and bagel for breakfast and asked the front desk who was more than happy (almost excited) to direct us to the best bakery in the north end. our check out was a breeze. we walked to the northend (10 mins)and to/from the opera house (20-30 mins each way) also did the freedom trail. It is located pretty right around the corner from the "garden" and north station. although we did her someone in the bathroom once while we were in the hall , the hotel was very quiet once inside our room. We would definately stay at the bulfinch again for a quick overnight and reccomend them to our friends

Reviews.Title: “Love This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CristinaNYC
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Bulfinch twice. The first time on business and the second as a weekend away with my boyfriend. The rooms are very small but very clean and comfortable with lots of pillows. On my first stay I was only booked for one night and the woman at the front desk extended my stay even before they received a cancellation, which was good because apparently this I went during a very popular weekend. On my second stay the room was just as clean as comfortable and the staff just as wonderful. This was definitely the BEST hotel I have ever stayed at and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: arisaig
Reviews.Content: We were not sure what to expect from this hotel after reading some of the reviews, but we were very pleased with what we got. I booked on priceline so it was in the area that we wanted but I did not choose the exact hotel. It was clean and well appointed, the location was great, an easy walk to Quincy Market, the restaurants and to all the main attractions. We found the staff to be excellent, courteous, helpful and attentive if necessary. The rooms may be on the small side but are absolutly fine for a short break, my daughter and I had enough space to unpack and to move around, the bed was very comfortable and there was no noise from anywhere. I would definitely use this hotel again when in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and Good Location”
Reviews.Author: VKayS
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel several weeks in advance and due to many events going on in Boston it was one of the few hotels in the $200-$300 price range in downtown Boston. We had an enjoyable stay. It was a good location for going to Quincy Market, Little Italy, The Gardens, and the North and Haymarket subway stops. The hotel people were very friendly and helpful. The restaurant had great oatmeal and coffee for $5. At night they specialize in Tapas. We did eat there one rainy night. The food was very good, but pricey for the portions. Everyday the hotel had free flavored waters. The beds and bedding were comfortable. The bathroom was large. My only criticism of the room was that it was very small and there was no place to put your suitcase. They didn't have a luggage rack so we had to put our suitcases on the floor. Also there were no drawers to put small items. I thought the shower smelled a little like mildew but my husband didn't think so. We would recommend this hotel and would stay here again. We are totally unfamiliar with hotels in the East.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean, quiet, friendly place”
Reviews.Author: mindyourownbusiness
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in November. Room was very clean and quiet, I didn't think it was that small (standard king) and had everything you needed for a short stay in Boston including free internet. The view was poor but I wasn't there to sit and look out of the hotel room window all day. All of the staff I spoke with were all friendly and helpful and made me feel welcome. Breakfast in the restaurant was good, and plenty of choices nearby. The hotel is not in a touristy area, it seems to be a regeneration project with some nice old warehouse type buildings being refurbished alongside office blocks, it is similar to the Shoreditch/Hoxton area of London and has a bit of an 'edge' but I never felt uncomfortable on my own at night - be streetwise. Great location for easy walking and access to the "T" to explore all that Boston has to offer. The hotel is across the street from the Hurley Building that was used as the State Police HQ in the filming of "The Departed" so get over there and have your picture taken on the steps. Liked the hotel and loved Boston.

Reviews.Title: “would return cheap deal”
Reviews.Author: sueFarehamUK
Reviews.Content: having just returned from Boston today, 15/11/07, i wanted to write this review before my thoughts turn to something else. I travelled down from Bar harbour in Maine and North Conway then into Boston. I stayed at the Bulfinch for 4 nights. Our initial thoughts were that we were met at the front door by a young male who yes looked a bit shabby but was very helpful. He informed us that he was tired because the lift had broken down earlier in the day and that he had been carrying the bags up the stairs. I wasnt really interested but just nodded, we were then guided into our room, Our room consisted of a double bed, a desk and chair and a half size wardrobe. The room was VERY! small compared to what we had been staying in but it was very clean and had an upto date modern appearance. The hotel is in the best location with everything close to hand, even china town is within walking distance. We booked our hotel through a web site and paid little for our accomodation. On reading the room rates on the wardrobe door it would appear that they are charging $400 per night. If i had to pay that then i would have something to moan about. Whilst staying i received a telephone call from the UK telling me some bad news, On hearing the message i went to speak to the receptionist "Ryan", he was so helpfull, he even let me use the telephone to call home, Free of charge!, from reading the other reviews i can understand that yes the rooms are small, but i could not fault anything else really. Boston wasnt really my thing but if i return one day i would be willing to stay at the Bulfinch again. Sue and Justin from Fareham England.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Skamom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent a weekend in Boston visiting our son and stayed 3 nights at the Bulfinch Hotel. The location is great and close to everything! I am sure we will go back when the weather is nicer, though. We had a nice room with a very comfortable king size bed. There were adequate towels and nice amenities--although we didn't buy the $4.00 Danish water in the room! There was no rack for the suitcase, but we didn't bother to ask for one. A comfortable chair would have been nice, but there was a desk and chair and they provided an umbrella, which we really needed! There is a tapas bar downstairs, which my husband tried and enjoyed and plenty of other places around to eat at. Most hotels seem pricey in Boston, so for $269 a night I don't know if this was a good price or not. I would definitely recommend it--the staff was always pleasant and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but...”
Reviews.Author: Edd_7
Reviews.Content: Plus points? Decent-sized rooms, a lovely bar (Jamie the barman was ace and the chef was really friendly and sweet too), plus the hotel is within short walking distance of the North End of town (great for Italian restaurants), Union Street (cheesy bars) and the city (for the trad tourist trail) -- though it's not the most scenic of locations. Minuses? Whatever you do, don't get a room number with a 9 on the end of it - they are next to the building's central electricty shaft/area and therefore have this really annoying, loud, drive-you-crazy buzzing noise all night.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but not the best choice”
Reviews.Author: holsLondon
Reviews.Content: We were shown to our room and discovered that the duvet cover was stained and the bed sheets ripped, which was a bit unpleasant. The hotel itself is fine but overpriced. The front desk staff are not particularly helpful or friendly. This is not a good choice if you want to feel like you are in the heart of Boston but the airport is reasonably accessible by taxi (approx 15 minutes/ $20 if traffic isnâ€™t too heavy). Whilst the hotel is close to the North End, the area surrounding the hotel is slightly industrial and can feel unsafe late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Find!”
Reviews.Author: L-Wag
Reviews.Content: 3 Friends and I stayed at the Bulfinch for 4 nights in July (7-11). We had a fantastic stay. We had a room with 2 double beds. It was more then enough room for 4 girls. The room, and the entire hotel, was clean. The decor was very stylish. The bathrooms were especially nice. In the lobby there was alway tea and coffee available. A great way to start or end your day. There is also a coffee maker in the rooms. The staff was very friendly. You have to walk by the front desk to get the the elevators, we always got some kind of pleasant salutation from the staff. Its also a good security measure, and they see who goes up the elevators. The hotel restaurant is great. We'd totally recommend eating at least one meal in there. Also, make use of the transit system. It is a great, safe and inexpensive way to get anywhere in the Metro Boston area. Even back the the airport. While the hotel seems pricey, you can most certainly get a good deal. I found a decent price on their website with the AAA discount. I called the hotel directly to see what price they could give me. I told the guy that I'd book on the website that I'd could get a better deal there, and he ended up giving me an even better deal then the website!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: thesciencegirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well situated for walking tours of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: LolyWalky
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at The Paramount in New York and the Clift in San Francisco, I find the Bulfinch very similar; trendy, contemporary and cosmopolitan. The rooms are a little small for most cities, but not for Boston, where space is at a premium. The rooms were clean and the staff friendly and helpful. I especially found the beds to be extremely comfortable and compare with some of my most memorable hotel experiences.

Reviews.Title: “Okay at $150 a Night, But Overpriced at $309 a Night”
Reviews.Author: kelly06777
Reviews.Content: The Bullfinch strives to be a stylish, upscale boutique hotel--a la Boston's vastly superior (if more expensive) Nine Zero--but it doesn't quite succeed. The lobby is small and cramped, the hallways look cheap, the rooms have run-of-the-mill linens but no mini-bars, and the staff seems overworked and under-polished. The neighborhood surrounding the hotel is one part interesting 19th century industrial architecture and two parts modernist dystopia. The Bullfinch sits directly across from the Government Center, a sprawling complex of hulking brutalist structures and concrete plazas, which are largely devoid of vegetation and pedestrian life--and which separate the Bullfinch neighborhood from Boston's broader urban fabric. Ergo, what should be a pleasant walk to the North End, Financial District, and Beacon Hill is instead unpleasant, if not downright depressing. All in all, I'd be satisfied with the Bullfinch if the rooms were $150 a night, but at twice that price, they don't represent a good value. Better, I think, to find a good deal at a generic hotel at Copley Square, or to spend a bit more and stay at Nine Zero.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay at the Bullfinch”
Reviews.Author: rjkcpktrips
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Bullfinch in early February over a weekend. We had stayed there the first time in June 2005. This stay was just as terrific! We stayed in a king bed sized room. Granted, this is a boutique hotel with small rooms. The rooms are comfortable, clean, and really work for the hotel. We arrived at the hotel at 10:30 AM and were able to check in that Friday which was a perfect start to the weekend. No problems with the room. We ended up going to a Celtics game that night (which is the perfect location for a Celtics game, or any event at the TD Banknorth Garden). Saturday night we ate on the North End (Little Italy). There are plenty of small bars in the area. Once again Quincy Market and Fanueil Hall are a 10 minute walk away. The North Station is at the Garden which is 5 minutes. I cannot say enough of this hotel. We had driven our first trip, and took a plane this time. Easy trip from Logan to here. I will definately stay here for my next trip in Boston. I cannot recommend Boston and this hotel enough. If you need a drink (and are preferably Irish) Sullivan's Tap is a must! They are friendly, but this place is a dive.

Reviews.Title: “Another Excellent Stay at the Bulfinch”
Reviews.Author: allpro13
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent one night at the Bulfinch Hotel on June 2, 2007. This was our 2nd stay at the Bulfinch. We had stayed a couple of years ago shortly after the hotel opened. I had read some of the latest reviews on T/A and was a little concerned that the Bulfinch might have gone downhill since my last stay. Nothing could be further from the truth. The Bulfinch continues to be an excellent value in the North Station area of Boston. As I was arriving in Boston around 1:00 PM I had emailed the hotel to ask for an early arrival. This was not a problem at all. I had booked one of the larger "nose" rooms at the hotel to see what they were like. Check in was very smooth and I was in my 3rd floor nose room in no time. The nose room really was worth the extra $$$. The windows on all sides of the room are great. It really makes the room feel larger. The room was very clean and was very practical. I felt the bedding was excellent and the bed was very comfortable. I did not try the restaurant at the hotel as I prefer to eat in the Italian North End when visiting Boston. The location of this hotel is a positive and a negative in my mind. If you are in Boston to see an event at the TD Banknorth Garden or if you wish to be near Faneuil Hall or the North End then this hotel is in a great location. There are also a bunch of Irish Pubs in the area. However, I find the area makes me a little nervous in terms of saftey. While I have never had a problem in the North Station area of Boston, I just don't feel as safe in this area as I do in the Back Bay section. There just doesn't seem to be as many people around in the area of the hotel. However, this would not stop me from staying at the Bulfinch again. It really is a great property and is an excellent value!

Reviews.Title: “Glad I found it!”
Reviews.Author: BKLYNGK
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife spent two nights at Bulfinch over the Memorial Day weekend. I preferred an inexpensive, yet decent hotel in the vicinity of Faneuil Hall, and I sure found one! The price of $139/ night was great given the holiday weekend and hotel's location. It is only a five minute walk from Faneuil Hall and within a walking distance to Boston Common and other major tourist destinations. I wasn't able to find anything cheaper in that area. However, that doesn't mean the hotel lacked on anything. One needs to keep in mind that it's a relatively small and quiet (on a weekend) hotel. It must've been recently renovated, because all of the interior looked very fresh if not new. Our room, located on the 7th floor, was quite small, which didn't concern me but may be a problem to some. Overall, the hotel makes an excellent choice for those on a budget yet preferring a modern and clean-cut venue in the heart of Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Just awful”
Reviews.Author: snyc9
Reviews.Content: I don't even know where to begin. This hotel let me down in such a major way. I have no idea why this one is #11 of all Boston hotel, when it should be at least 45 in my opinion. I am an experienced traveler, who has stayed in all kind of hotels, from cheap roadside motels to fancy Ritz Carltons. The Bulfinch has the quality of the former, much more than the latter. And here's why: It's cheap through and through. Not cheap in price, mind you -- because it does bill itself as a "hip boutique" hotel -- but cheap in its materials, construction, design. In everything. Let's start with their reception. My sister and I arrived late in the evening to find one lone person working behind the desk in the tiny lobby. It took him about 20 minutes to look up our info, get our keys ready. It was the longest check-in I've ever experienced. While I waited for this guy, I helped myself to the coffee that was by the one lone elevator that serves this seven-story building. Alas, both the milk and cream containers were empty -- first sign of trouble ahead. Finally, we had our keys and headed to our room. We walked in -- but it was a room with one bed, when we had very clearly booked online and got confirmation for a deluxe double. Back downstairs we went, followed by more waiting. The guy told us that they actually had no doubles. Excellent! This was getting interesting...Ultimately, the guy -- without any kind of apology for the error in their system with our booking -- placed one of us in their "classic" room and the other in the suite. On two different floors. Ok, both rooms are pathetically tiny. But the "classic" room is really a walk-in closet. There's a full-size bed (it's been a while since I've seen a full-size bed in a hotel single room, most normal hotel singles come with queen beds) that is literally wedged into a nook in the room. There is about foot between the wall and the bed, making it quite a challenge to get in and out of it. A tiny wardrobe (there's no closet) with a desk and a large, heavy cumbersome chair as well as a large TV (all the furniture had cracks and chips on it) completed the decor. There's no bath tub. They could have easily fit one into the bathroom, but chose to only have a small shower instead. Cheap. The towels are horrible -- coarse and flat. The hotel didn't want to invest in nice towels. The design is awkward. The doors of the wardrobe bang against the desk when opened. The toilet paper roll in the bathroom is placed so far from the toilet that you have to practically get up off the toilet to reach it. There are gaps between the window and the wall -- weird long gaps. But the worst of all things was the bed. It was the worst bed I had ever slept on -- some cheap brand I had never heard of, reminded me of a cot I slept on in camp. It had no thickness, sank like a hole in the middle, had no kind of pillowtop as is standard in a boutique hotel. I had aches all over my body after a night on that mattress. The pillows were all mismatched, the comforter was the weirdest I've ever seen -- had no quilting and depth in the middle, but just around the edges. So it was like a flat sheet with quilting around it. Very weird. Also had a nice brown stain on it. If a hotel cannot provide an adequate bed and bedding, then it has truly failed in my eyes. This one did. The building has no kind of security. At one point, the guy downstairs (the one who took ages to check us in) just disappeared somewhere and was gone for a while. There was no one minding the front entrance. Anyone from the street could have walked in. I am not complaining here, I am literally describing what I saw. If you don't feel like you require a comfy bed in your hotel, then stay here; or stay if you don't mind cheap, chipped furnishings, or if you don't mind a room about 150 sq. feet, or if you don't mind not having security in the hotel...But at an average price of $170 a night, you can do much better than the Bulfinch. This is a hotel that doesn't really care about its guests. Its owners greed shows in every cheap shortcut to "luxury" -- the illusion of "luxury" -- they take here.
