Reviews.Title: “Bulfinch staff: over promise, under deliver.”
Reviews.Author: Valdiri
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Bulfinch for a weekend. You should know that this hotel was a â€˜Clarion Collectionâ€� hotel recently, but is now independent. I am not sure why they left the Choice Hotel chain, but based on my experience with the staff there, it hasnâ€™t helped their ability to serve the customer. The room: My room was very tasteful and modern. It has a very upscale feel to it and materials were very nice. A white (so you know it is clean) duvet cover is always a plus in my books. Good quality toiletries. Comfortable bed. Parking; You should know that this hotel has no parking â€“ there is a deal arranged with a 24 hour garage about 200 yards away where you can save a few dollars over their regular price. The staff: Hereâ€™s the rub. I donâ€™t know why companies can invest so much into designing and building their beautiful hotels and then ruin things by cutting corners by hiring inexperienced, inexpensive staff. The oldest of the 3 front desk people I dealt with during my stay couldnâ€™t have been older than 22 or 23. I arrived at 2:45 to check in but Layla informed me my room wasnâ€™t ready and it would be 5 or 10 minutes â€“ check in wasnâ€™t until 3 so that was acceptable. When I asked again at 3:00 if my room was ready Jennifer informed me that â€˜sorry but guaranteed check in isnâ€™t until 3â€™ . At 3:20 I asked what the guarantee that she referred to was â€“ when pressed, she admitted that there isnâ€™t actually a guarantee. Again it would be another 5 or 10 minutesâ€¦ In the end, I didnâ€™t get a room until almost an hour after â€˜guaranteedâ€™ check in. I understand mistakes and delays happen, but it is the actions and attitude of the staff that can make it pleasant or not. I later reported all this to the Director of Operations Adrian who seemed competent â€“ but it has been weeks now and he never got back to me as he promised to do. I wouldnâ€™t necessarily advise against staying here, but I wonder if things are changing for the worse now that they are a non-affiliated hotel.

Reviews.Title: “My Favourite Bed in Boston”
Reviews.Author: NBChrista
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit at the Bulfinch, being repeat customers since our excellent stay last year. My fiance and I arrived Friday afternoon, enjoyed a speedy check-in, ultra-warm staff, and a super-comfortable, high-quality room. For those who like wide-open spaces and hotels rooms large enough to house a small army, this may not be the ideal choice of accomodation. What the Bulfinch has brilliantly done is taken a small and unique piece of real estate and turned it into a reasonably priced hotel with comfortable king-sized beds with Egyptian cotton sheets (and duvet cover), marble bathrooms, and great interior design. The reason it is reasonably priced is because of the room size - we had just enough room for the bed and our bags, and a walk-in glass/marble shower instead of a full bathtub. To my thinking, it's perfect - a super-nice room, modern and meticulously cleaned, no gross polyester bedspread, and affordable for a weekend getaway to see the Red Sox. The restaurant has been redone since we were here last, and although we didn't eat there the menu looked terrific and not too expensive. The tea/coffee station in the lobby was a big bonus, with lots of herbal tea options in addition to the old standards. The location has been well-commented on by others; I completely agree with all of the positive comments - close to Boston Gardens, the T, Quincy Market. In addition, it was easy to find from the highway (I-93). Parking is underground in a secure garage just around the corner (a 1-2 minute walk), $25 per day I think, but well worth it for peace of mind. In summary, fabulous hotel, quality staff, quality rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, hotel is a gem”
Reviews.Author: MarkConnecticut
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a difficult night while my wife was hospitalized at Mass. General. The staff is fantastic: thoughtful, friendly, efficient and kind. Rooms are small, bed is extremely comfortable. Could use more comfortable arm chair; otherwise just about perfect. Location and first rate and caring staff make this a great choice for those with family at Mass. General.

Reviews.Title: “Small piece of Boston”
Reviews.Author: TravelingJournal
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was not all that big, and the rooms were even smaller. The bathroom has a shower stall, but no bathtub. This place was made to be efficient in just getting you by for your stay, and I believe it does the job sufficiently. With all that said, I still rate this place to be excellent for several reasons. First of all, it's right by North Station, where the Bruins and the Celtics both play. The walk to the subway station "North Station" is 3 short blocks away, and since it is in front of the stadium, there are many great eateries in the area at late night. I got lucky in that i spent very little money for a place right in the middle of town, but in return i got a sufficient sized room for the 4 of us. They do allow early checkin, and they even allowed us for a late checkout at 2:30pm. I enjoyed my stay, and plan to go again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Fantastic Location.”
Reviews.Author: American_Travellers
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights in early November on our recent extended trip to the U.S. This hotel was fantastic, commencing with a very warm greeting followed by convenience in location. Close to Boston Gardens, Train Station, Convenience shops, Dunkin Donuts , great Pubs and Restaurants. All of these are within walking distance. The room itself, whilst not large was very modern, the bed is extremely comfortable, well maintained and the bathroom fairly spacious. The only Con to our experience at this hotel was the elevator being offline for 2 nights. There is only one elevator, we where on the 8th floor so we had to walk up and down, however this did not bother us with the exception of check out in getting our bags down the stairs. It certainly was challenging for the staff to manage this, however the hotel staff maintained excellent service and where kind enough to componsate our bill, which was much appreciated. There is no going past this hotel and would recommend it to any traveller. I certainly upon return to Boston would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveler526
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Bulfinch Hotel during a recent business trip to Boston, and the hotel certainly lived up to every single one of the excellent reviews it has received on Tripadvisor. The hotel rooms are spotless, there is free internet service in every room, and the staff was very helpful. I will definitely stay here again the next time I'm in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Much Thanks to the Bulfinch Staff”
Reviews.Author: lvelaz6148
Reviews.Content: All hotels could take lessons from the Bulfinch. My stay was for it's location. Walking distance to one of America's best Rehabilitation Hospitals, Spaulding. My husband had broken his neck in a severe accident, very nearly died. It was the most difficult time of my life. On my way to and from the hospital, the desk attendant asked me every morning and every night how my husband was doing. All staff offered assistance as often as they could to ease my burden. The General Manager himself took time to speak with me, even loaning a hug during a time when I was told my husband of 20 years may be brain damaged and I couldn't stop the tears. I would highly recommend this hotel, for location, for the caring, genuine concern of it's staff, excellent food in restaraunt, and ample places to go in walking distance. My stay there, helped me through the most difficult time of my life. Many heartfelt thanks to Mr. Hartwell, Christian, and the girl at the desk each morning who always had a smile and kind words. Bless You All

Reviews.Title: “Thanks all for reviews - Loved it”
Reviews.Author: bigdx3
Reviews.Content: The reviews on this site of this hotel were great. They gave a completely accurate picture of what to expect. The hotel is more of an European hotel, w/ small lobby, small rooms, but just what a family of six needed in the summer. We shared two corner rooms that were clean and comfortable and had nice a/c. (If you are spending too much time in the room, you aren't taking advantage of a great city). If you have to stay in the room all is well, the bathrooms were large, modern and clean, the beds were absolutely fine. The only real down side for us was really the location, which sounds funny, but it was because we had a car. For those with a car, there is no real parking, so you have to park at a garage across the street. But parking is available if you need it, and parking is a nightmare in the city anyway. The area it is located is near where the old Boston garden was, so if you can picture the area, you know it is near the heart of everything in Boston. My son and I walked to the Science museum, walked to the T to see the Red Sox and for people without kids, it is probably even better. There is a au bon pain that is open on the weekdays in a bld next door and a bunch of other small restaurants nearby. Otherwise the hotel and the people who run it were great. I meant to write a review awhile ago, but time flies. Love you Boston!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: JPJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bulfinch for two nights in early November. The hotel is very nice, but the rooms are extremely small. It didn't bother us because we weren't planning on spending all of our time in the room. The hotel rates are very reasonable compared to other hotels in the area. The decor and bed linens were very nice and modern. As for parking, we booked a "park, stay and play" package that I found on the website. Our rate was maybe $5-10 more per night. This was great because normally parking cost $25/day. The parking garage is about 1 block away from the hotel. The hotel is in a great location. There are 2 "T" stops within a few minutes walk. There are plenty of bars and restaurants in the area. I would definitely recommend the Bulfinch.

Reviews.Title: “a great value City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brude
Reviews.Content: This is a great city hotel. Clean, well positioned, good value and efficient. Used it for a couple of days whilst in Boston. It is well located and within a short walk to all the city centre landmarks. Car parking is $25 a day in a nearby car park which you pay through the hotel. Room had everything we needed and was typical city hotel size, compact. Shower room was very well provisioned and the whole package was well looked after on the cleanliness side. The restaurant was closed during my stay, which was puzzling, but a nearby bar provided great meals and the centre haunts were close. A good buy in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Well placed-Bullfinch”
Reviews.Author: Welshfifty
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Bullfinch for 3 nights at the beginning of our holiday to New England to see "the Fall". Couldn't have picked a better hotel. Near to Quincy Hall and the Italian quarter. Staff were very helpful. Patrick in particular was very friendly and helpful. Found a good cafe just around the corner for breakfast, which was reasonable. The room was clean and if by American standards a little small, we British are not used to two big beds in one room so found it adequate. All in all a good choice!!

Reviews.Title: “little gem”
Reviews.Author: Sumas
Reviews.Content: We just stayed in this hotel while visiting my son at college. It is very interesting as built in an old 'flat iron' building, which is triangularly shaped. We had a 'corner' room, which is in the point or nose of the triangle. We had an incredibly comfortable king sized bed, and a pull out sofa. The room was not large, and was oddly shaped due to the building, but very modern, clean and comfortable. The bathroom was very large, marble, large shower, very modern and nice. Location was a short (3 block)walk to Haymarket 'T' station so convenient to all. There is a restaurant attached which has just been bought out so is not open now. Lobby had not only coffee and teas 24 hrs but also lg water canister with lemon wedges in it which was a nice touch (as a no-caffeine person). Staff very nice, one drawback was only one ice machine on 3rd floor right now. Would stay here again and recommend this hotel for price, beds, bathrooms and location near "T" station.

Reviews.Title: “Gracious staff, very clean”
Reviews.Author: humuhumu
Reviews.Content: We had this as a back up hotel, and it was a good thing. The first place we stayed was a dive. We came in to the Bulfinch at 8 am, inquiring about our room, knowing it was too early. They had rooms available and let us check in! The staff was very gracious in all our requests. The room was small, but the a/c was great (it was 90+ degrees that week in Boston). At that time they didn't have a restaurant. It was a short walk to the subway. Was very reasonable for Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal city centre Location”
Reviews.Author: CliveGerrard
Reviews.Content: The Bullfinch hotel is ideally suited for a city centre stay, with easy access to all the main sites of Boston. The hotel was clean and the staff courteous and helpful. Our room was extremely small but fairly well equipped. It was a little on the expensive side but not unreasonably so, for a city centre hotel. The hotel has no restaurant, as such, with a steak house next door. Don't bother to eat there - go to one of the many pubs and restaurants in Quincy Market, ten minutes away. For a great location, you can't really go wrong with the Bullfinch.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely good”
Reviews.Author: garycheronerocks
Reviews.Content: Came to boston for the Extreme concert at the end of June, Boston pavilion, chose this hotel because of the architecture and thought the location looked good, it was, after taking a wrong turn the first morning found out it was so close to everything really. Staff great, room spotless, steakhouse downstairs was quiet but food excellent. We had a late flight back to UK (8pm) so wanted to freshen up and get changed beforehand, the staff had no problem with us taking over the basement restrooms to do so, we'd been out all day and although we'd checked out earlier and secured out bags with them it wasn't a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place! Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: SeekingPerfection
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights. Very clean and quiet. Stayed in a nose suite - worth the extra money. Basically a triangular-shaped room with bedroom area and living room area. Not very large, but beautiful linens and new furniture. Marble bathroom. Aveda toiletries. Hotel small, not many rooms on each floor, plus hallway has angles - so rarely heard anyone in the hallways. Perfect location to walk to Beacon Hill, MEEI, Boston Garden, North End, etc. Highly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, highly recomended!”
Reviews.Author: Mike1111
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel is within walking distance of many Boston sights. If the walk is to far then there are 2 different subway stations within blocks of the hotel. Many pro's about the hotel (clean room, comfy bed, big clean bathrooms) but only 1 minor con...small room. Barely enough room to walk around the bed. Regardless, I would stay again and recomend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Such a cozy little place!”
Reviews.Author: racerdog
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel - we loved it there! We booked two rooms in August for my family and we were pleasantly surprised. The rooms were small but bright and well appointed. The bathroom was lovely. My son loved playing on the bed next to the window on the window sill while watching people walk by. It also was very quiet! Quick walk to Fan. Hall and nice restaurants. Quick walk to great Italian restaurants and public transportation. The staff was friendly, esp the bartender in the restaurant downstairs. I would definately stay there again - was great & therefore really helped make our trip to Boston great!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place!”
Reviews.Author: ElisaPrimaveri
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving at this hotel we were greated by a very friendly front desk girl. We were checked in promptly. Our room was small but very comfortable. It had everything we needed. It was very clean and had a nice design. The bathroom was not as small as I heard from other reviews. I had just stayed in NY at the Hudson Hotel and the bathroom there was half the size of this one. The bathroom was clean and had all the things we needed (lotion, shampoo, conditioner, blow dryer, plenty of towels). The steak house on the lobby level was a very good experience for us, they stayed open late to accommodate weary travelors like us. The manager Paul was very nice and accommodating. The food was a little pricy, but the steaks were cooked to perfection. The location of the hotel is pretty good, you are within a 10 minute walk to Fanuel Hall and with 15 minute walk to the North End, yet it was a very quite area. Overall it was a great place to stay, it was only about $145 a night, I will definately be back again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: RASSIG
Reviews.Content: The Bulfinch Hotel is a very nice hotel ! Good location a few blocks from Faneheuil Market and Quincy Market near nice restaurants and near the subway . The room is nice very well decorated the bed is wonderful really confortable . The only bad thing is they don`t have a frigobar in the room . I would stay there again !

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: katdog
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of June for four nights. The room was very small, which would have been OK, but there was almost no room to put your clothes. Bathroom was not bad, except for the lack of space to stash belongings again. Contrary to the Choice Hotels web site, there is no complimentary breakfast, but the cafe a block away was good. And there was no room service as mentioned in the hotel room service book. The location is w/i walking distance of most of the major touristy sites and a short walk to the T. Our biggest 'problem' was with housekeeping. Our first day, we received no service (not a big deal), second day OK, third day they serviced our room, but removed all the soap. Our friends staying in another room had the same problem. That same evening we overheard a very upset guest also complaining about lack of housekeeping service. We also noticed our razor was missing, as was a bag of crackers - very bizarre. But the rooms are very clean, if only because it's a newer hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointing”
Reviews.Author: MJCB
Reviews.Content: Admittedly, our expectations might have been a bit high following rave reviews read on Tripadvisor. We stayed here for one night in May. The elevator was broken, which did not help (we noticed it was fixed the next day). Using the fire escape stairs to get to one's floor did also not help with first impressions. The corridor outside the rooms are very depressing and reminds one of a block of flats rather than a hotel. The room interiors are much better and the bed is large, comfortable and everything is very clean and tidy. Some rooms have a shower only and others have bathtubs. (we changed rooms). Room and batroom are a bit on the small side. It is not the type of room or hotel where we felt we wanted to relax in and enjoy ourselves. You feel the reverse - you want to get out. It definitely has more of a businessman's feel to it. It is closer to the waterfront (we took a taxi) and the museum where the duckmobile tours start (we walked there) than to the other popular Boston attractions. The other disadvantage is that parking your car involves a paid covered carpark around the corner which is also where the closest breakfast place it located. We were glad we were only here for one night.

Reviews.Title: “Great!!”
Reviews.Author: BanaPona
Reviews.Content: We loved the Bulfinch. The only negative things that I can say are (1) a couple staff gave us some bum advice about ATMs and convenience stores (they are both available just across the street), (2) the bathrooms can be cold in the summer â€“ with blasting air-con there that you cannot control, and (3) there is almost no closet room. But these are such small things. All else is great at the Bulfinch. The location is great. There are nice conveniences kiddy-corner - - a convenience store with ATM and a nice little place where you can grab breakfast. It is a short walk to the State House and Faneuil Hall, and in the other direction the Garden if you are here for a game or concert. It is a short walk (5 min) to the Haymarket T-station - - and about same distance to North Station, though Haymarket is a better walk at night (I guess unless there is an event at the Garden). The young staff is very friendly and helpful â€“ it is a hotel where you feel a personal touch â€“ after just a day the staff will know you as you walk in. The building itself is also very quaint â€“ sort of a Boston version of the Flairtron Building. The rooms are cool and if you can afford â€“ definitely get a â€œnose-roomâ€� suite. While the room may seem narrow - - but it is long and you have windows everywhere with some nice views. I love natural light and these suites definitely have them everywhere including the bathroom (we could see the Garden from the bathroom â€“ and when we showered I could even see the State House looking into the living room). The bed was big and comfortable. Overall, I really loved staying at the Bulfinch - - I love Boston and the Bulfinch is a great way to stay in this great city.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Good location; reasonable price; nice rooms and lobby, BUT... No valet parking (and $25 to self park a block away), room service did not come until we called at 4 pm to request it; and other minor room problems were not addressed due to lack of handyman on premisis. Lots of apologies, but little action. Added up to a rather frustrating experience and not what I expect of a boutique hotel. Not sure I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Rain didn't stop us”
Reviews.Author: oceanbeachgirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during the wettest time Boston has ever had, but the great location of this hotel made it easy for us to walk around and see the sites, even though we did get a little wet. The hotel staff was excellent, always friendly, and knowledgable about the area, and always willing to help and give directions. Everyone went out of their way to make you feel great about staying at this hotel. We had a room with two double beds, that were so comfortable, it made you feel like you were at the Ritz, with the nice pillows and the down comfortors, one of the nicest beds I've ever slept in. The bathroom was as wide as the room, with marble flooring, and the see through shower stall, looked so elaborate. With the great location, plus the friendly service, (great to see people who are so friendly ) makes this hotel a great choice to stay at. I hope I can go back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: boundforboston
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just got back from a wonderful 4 night stay at the Bulfinch. We were in a perfect location to visit all of the historic sites and only had to take a cab to and from the airport. It's only a short walk to Quincy Market, the North End, Freedom Trail, etc. We coudn't have asked for a more perfect location. The rooms were tiny but quite clean. The front desk was very helpful and for the price (AAA rate) we couldn't hope for anything better. We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Boston and when we come back the Bulfinch is where we will stay!

Reviews.Title: “Super location!”
Reviews.Author: groovywilma
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Bulfinch Hotel for 4 nights. There were 3 adults, so we booked a room with 2 double beds. Our room was on the 7th floor. The beds were extremely comfortable! The room was clean and well taken care of. There is very limited closet space. Unfortunately, we were there during the very rainy weekend, so only got one chance to walk from the hotel to Fanueil Hall. It was a very quick walk! The rain put a damper to our weekend in Boston, but the comfy beds made it very relaxing. One negative thing that happened was that the only elevator in the hotel was not working for one whole day. This made it difficult having to climb up and down 7 flights of stairs, especially one member of our group having a heart condition. The elevator was back in service the next day. We ate at the hotel restaurant twice while there (b/c the rain prevented a lot of exploring) but the food was very good, although a little pricey. The staff were nice and friendly. Peet's Coffee and Tea were served in the lobby. We were able to book the government rate, which was a good price. I would come back to the Bulfinch again.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish but pricey”
Reviews.Author: Advisor20
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bullfinch hotel for 3 nights in May 2006. It was a high quality boutique style business hotel. The room was a good size with excellent facilities, decorated tastefully in a modern/minimalist style. The bathroom though small was stylish and had a large marble walk-in shower (no bath). The kingsize bed was extremely comfortable. The location was great, just a ten minute walk from Quincy Market and the Freedom Trail. It was also close to the Italian Quarter. The hotel was pricey however, but we did feel that we got reasonable value for our money as it was centrally located, and very modern with good facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great position - friendly staff - what more can i say - i'd recommend it to all my friends and family!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Bulfinch”
Reviews.Author: Penkers
Reviews.Content: I'd recommend the Bulfinch to anyone coming to Boston. I travelled as a single woman and found the service at the hotel to be good, and the location fine - no problems walking to and from town in the evening. Positives: Very modern decor in the rooms; Cosy comfortable beds; Reliable, complimentary high-speed internet access, if you have a laptop; Very clean - housekeeping was excellent; Powerful shower and a large cubicle; Excellent steaks in the restaurant downstairs. Negatives: No room service (but, as has been mentioned elsewhere - there are many fast-food joints round the corner, near the Garden and numerous restaurants in the main town); It's slightly out of the main tourist drag - but no more than a 10 minute walk to the Faneuil Hall shopping area along a pretty busy main road. Very close to the Garden - if you're here for a sporting event.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay At The Bulfinch”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Let me just say one word......Excellent! Not your usual location for staying in Boston, but you must give this place a try. Having stayed there on two occasions over the past few years, there's little left wanting. I know I'll be back again next year!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: FFXVA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bulfinch while in Boston en route to the White Mountains of New Hampshire. We had tickets to the Bruins game that evening and the hotel is an easy walk to the Garden. The North End and Quincy Marketplace are also in walking distance as are a number of pubs and restaurants. While our room was on the small side, it was extremely clean, very attractively decorated, and perfectly fine for a short stay. The front desk staff was very helpful and assisted me in arranging for delivery of a rental car to the hotel on the day of our departure.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Little Gem with Beds to Die For!”
Reviews.Author: D_M_and_A
Reviews.Content: OK, I have to say that I had just stayed three nights with colleagues at a large chain hotel on business before staying at the Bulfinch Hotel by myself on my last night. I wish I had stayed at the Bulfinch all week! It was a very, very pleasant stay. The Bulfinch is within walking distance of most of the major points of interest. However, what really set this hotel apart for me was the quality and friendliness of the staff as well as the cool rooms. I would consider this a "boutique" hotel, so if you are looking for a large lobby to hang out in, or a pool for the kids, this isn't for you. However, since I was by myself and only had a day and a half to see the sights, I couldn't have picked a better place - great staff, super comfy beds, quiet rooms (no neighbor or street noise), free internet access, nice view from the upper floor. I had two SMALL problems while staying here: 1) The hot water didn't work in the sink in my first room. This was so promptly attended to (I was immediately put in a room on the 8th floor - bonus for me!) that I was almost embarrassed at the number of apologies and the amount of attention I received. 2) There is no room service. Even though a somewhat overpriced restaurant is connected to the hotel, you have to go down through the lobby if you want a snack or something to eat. This was somewhat of an inconvenience for me personally. All around, however, this was an awesome experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and great location for Garden and Quincy Mkt”
Reviews.Author: geekie
Reviews.Content: Just spent 2 nights at the Bulfinch, while in town for Billy Joel. This hotel has a great location, just around the corner from the Garden. The rooms are small, but large enough for 2. We had a king bed on the 2nd floor. The bed is just the most comfortable bed I have ever slept on! Plenty of great pillows as well. Probably the one negative point would be the bathroom, it had a sliding door on it that doesn't offer much privacy and has only a large shower, no tub. The staff at the hotel are very professional and helpful. We also enjoyed dinner at the Black Angus Steakhouse that is located in the hotel. Good service and a great dinner! If you are going to events at the Garden, this is the place to stay. Price was good, booked on Clarion website for $125.10/night with AAA. Parking is around the corner at $25.00/day with no in/out ability, you must be out by 12 noon on the day of checkout. Quincy Market/Faneuil Hall are about 1/4 mile away. Area seems safe enough, although we did encounter several people asking for money. If you are into nightlife, there are many bars/clubs within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Bullfinch a Winner!”
Reviews.Author: MysticKid
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Bullfinch after getting the link from the Celtics website. My 11 year old son and i were attending a Celtics game and game was going to end late on a Monday night so we chose to stay over. Bullfinch was a GREAT choice ! We originally requested a standarad room but they upgraded us to a junior suite on a AAA rate. Room was perfectly clean, 8th floor suite w/ tremendous windows. Bathroom w/ shower only was all marble, very cool w/ great shower. Ate in the Angus steakhouse downstairs w/ a so-so kitchen but the maitre D and waiter were so nice, free chocolate cake that they made up for it. Best of all, was the 2 block/2 minute walk to the Boston Garden. Christian the check in guy was so helpful and informative, simply great service. It was a dream nite for my 11 year old in Boston albeit the celts lost on a last second shot.

Reviews.Title: “What a great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bulfinch on Dec.9/05 for just one night. Now I wish it was a week! The staff were very helpful and friendly, the rooms were very modern, classy and the king size bed was probably the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in. As well, the restaurant in the hotel has the BEST beef that money can buy. If you get the chance to stay there or even if your just passing by, I highly recommend that you try either the Hamburger platter or the Rib Eye Steak sandwich. Nothing to complain about here. Even the price was reasonable($164.00) for downtown Boston. Thanks for making the trip perfect Bulfinch!

Reviews.Title: “An absolute Gem!”
Reviews.Author: stevekub
Reviews.Content: We were in Boston from October 30 - November 1, as a pre-cruise stay, and were quite impressed with this hotel. The lobby and public areas were spotless, and the hotel staff were friendly and available to help us with everything from dining suggestions to directions around town. The standard room we were in was very large for our needs, and we felt quite comfortable. Indeed, the first morning after arriving, we didn't want to get out from beneath the cozy surroundings. Our shower was well appointed and there was no lack of hot water for our morning routines. The bathrooms were well suited for 2 people getting ready in the morning. This is not an area with many hotels - indeed, our cab from Boston Back Bay to the hotel (which was $8, for reference) didn't know of the hotel, or that there was a hotel in the area! Close to public transportation (North Station), the Museum of Science, and plenty of fast food (Dunkin Donuts, Burger King, etc) and 24-hour convenience stores nearby. We felt quite comfortable at all times in the neighborhood, and most tourist spots we visited are a short walk or T ride away.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Things Come In Small Packages”
Reviews.Author: vikkiCork_Ireland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Bulfinch Hotel from 04 November until 10 November on a shopping trip from Ireland. The rooms were small even by European standards but they were very modern exceptionally clean and the showers were huge!! The rooms have very high ceilings which make them seem bigger than they are and the decor was great. The staff were so polite and helpful with any information or assistance we required before and during our stay. We were also given a late check out as our flight were in the evening and our luggage was held until departure. The hotel location is superb 5 minutes stroll to Quincy Market or The Fleet Centre, 10 minutes to Downtown Crossing and Cambridgeside. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Boston, it far outranks many hotels considered "superior" that I have stayed in on previous visits. The hotel does not serve breakfast but there is a great deli ( eat in or takeaway ) across the road. We found the level of service provided outstanding. A big thank you to Kathy, Lesley, Lindsey and of course James. We will be back!!!! And we plan to spread the word!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good for a short stay, but...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night while we were in town for a hockey game at the Garden. If the Garden is your destination, you can't beat this hotel for its location alone. It only took us a couple of minutes to walk door to door. The place is in great condition (it's new, so this is to be expected), and SPOTLESSLY clean (and I'm a fanatic when it comes to cleanliness in a hotel room). The bathrooms are very nice. On the downside, the rooms are TINY-- not "on the small side" but TINY. We had a room with two double beds, so perhaps the single-bed rooms have more elbow room. However, our room didn't even have enough space to open up a suitcase without putting it on the bed (no room for a valet here!) --definitely not a room I would want to stay in for several days. I thought the room was very expensive ($232 incl. taxes -- AAA rate), considering its size and the lack of amenities offered by this hotel. There is a decent steakhouse next door, but again, VERY expensive (it wasn't the food, but the bar bill that was a shocker!) There are, however, lots a restaurant options in the area. All in all, this hotel is very good, but overpriced. If you don't require a double room, and if you can get a good price on a room, grab it...I don't think you'll be disappointed. (A quick response to some other reviews: this is NOT a bad area of the city. I lived and worked in Boston for several years, and this area was always a little "grittier" than Back Bay or Beacon Hill, but it has undergone a gentrification of sorts in the past few years. The removal of the elevated train tracks in front of the Garden has also done a lot for this area. When (and if) the Big Dig is finished, this area will definitely be the better for it.)

Reviews.Title: “A New Gem in Boston”
Reviews.Author: CuriousGeorge_NY
Reviews.Content: I stayed here over the weekend. The rooms are compact but well decorated and designed; my room had a spacious bathroom with a large shower stall. The decor is modern and not overdone. The only criticism I can make is that the vending/ice machines had not been installed on my floor yet. The price ($154) was well worth it in my opinion. The hotel is only 3 short blocks from North Station; you can walk to the station in under 3 minutes. Fanueil Hall is a 5-8 minute walk.
